Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Intel, AMD, and ARM CPUs. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory.
A local user can exploit race conditions in CPU cache processing to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. This can be exploited to read arbitrary system register and memory contents on the target system.

A local user can conduct a side-channel attack to exploit a flaw in the speculative loading of system registers to read privileged system registers [CVE-2018-3640].

The CVE-2018-3640 vulnerability is referred to as "Spectre variant 3A".

A local user can conduct a side-channel attack to exploit a flaw in the speculative execution of Load and Store instructions to read privileged memory [CVE-2018-3639].

The CVE-2018-3639 vulnerability is referred to as "Spectre variant 4".

The original advisory is available at:

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/project-zero/issues/detail?id=1528

Zdenek Sojka, Rudolf Marek, and Alex Zuepke from SYSGO AG, Jann Horn (Google Project Zero), and Ken Johnson (Microsoft Security Response Center) reported these vulnerabilities.

Solution: The CPU vendors are providing software and firmware updates to mitigate the applicable vulnerabilities to operating system vendors and system manufacturers.

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Web Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Certain parameters sent via the HTTP GET and HTTP POST methods are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg86743 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180516-ident-se-xss

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Log Viewer Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The application management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in log files before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target administrator user's browser when the user views the log files. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh11308 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180516-ise-xss

Title: Cisco Meeting Server RTP Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Media Processes to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) bitstream to trigger an input validation flaw and cause media process crashes and deny access to audio and video services.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCve79693, CSCvf91393, CSCvg64656, CSCvh30725, and CSCvi86363 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target media processes to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180516-msms

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine EAP-TLS Certificate Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Extensible Authentication Protocol-Transport Layer Security (EAP-TLS) certificate to trigger a certificate validation flaw and cause the Identity Services Engine (ISE) application to restart.

This vulnerability can also be exploited by a remote authenticated administrator when importing a specially crafted EAP-TLS certificate into the ISE trust store.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve31857 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target ISE application server to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180516-iseeap

Title: McAfee Data Loss Prevention Endpoint Flaw Lets Local Users Bypass Security Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Data Loss Prevention Endpoint. A local user can bypass security restrictions.
A local user can generate a Master Response String on the target endpoint system to cause the DLP Endpoint protection mode to switch to bypass mode without authorization from McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator.

Communications Security Establishment Canada (CSEC) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the DLP Endpoint protection mode to switch to bypass mode.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix (10.0.500, 11.0.400).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10233

Privilege escalation may occur in the Qualcomm Kyro L2 driver component [CVE-2017-6423].

Denial of service conditions may occur in the kernel networking subsystem component [CVE-2014-2706].

Denial of service conditions may occur in the Qualcomm Wi-Fi driver component [CVE-2016-10235].

Privilege escalation may occur in the kernel file system component [CVE-2016-7097].

Privilege escalation may occur in the Qualcomm Wi-Fi driver component [CVE-2017-6424].

Privilege escalation may occur in the Broadcom Wi-Fi driver component [CVE-2016-8465].

Privilege escalation may occur in the HTC OEM fastboot command component [CVE-2017-0582].

Privilege escalation may occur in the Qualcomm CP access driver component [CVE-2017-0583].

Aravind Machiry of Shellphish Grill Team, Daxing Guo of Xuanwu Lab, Tencent, Derrek and Scott Bauer, Gal Beniamini of Project Zero, Gengjia Chen and pjf of IceSword Lab, Qihoo 360 Technology Co. Ltd., Guang Gong of Alpha Team, Qihoo 360 Technology Co. Ltd., Hao Chen of Alpha Team, Qihoo 360 Technology Co. Qihoo 360, Mark Salyzyn of Google, Mike Anderson and Nathan Crandall of Tesla's Product Security Team, Peng Xiao, Chengming Yang, Ning You, Chao Yang, and Yang song of Alibaba Mobile Security Group, Pengfei Ding, Chenfu Bao, and Lenx Wei of Baidu X-Lab, Qidan He of KeenLab, Tencent, Roee Hay of Aleph Research, HCL Technologies, Scott Bauer, 
Seven Shen of TrendMicro Mobile Threat Research Team, Tim Becker, Uma Sankar Pradhan, V.E.O of Mobile Threat Response Team, Trend Micro, Weichao Sun of Alibaba Inc, Wenlin Yang, Yonggang Guo of IceSword Lab, Qihoo 360 Technology Co. Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Web Gateway) Dhcp Reference Counter Overflow Lets Remote Users Cause the Target dhcpd Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Dhcp. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. McAfee Web Gateway is affected.
A remote user can send large amounts of data to the target server can send a large number of packets (e.g., billions of packets) to trigger a reference counter overflow and cause the target dhcpd service to consume all available memory and crash.

Felix Wilhelm, Google Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Web Gateway (7.7.2.12, 7.8.1.4).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10231

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Web Gateway) Dhcp Buffer Overflow in 'dhclient' Lets Remote Servers Cause the Target Client to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Dhcp. A remote user can cause the target dhclient to crash. McAfee Web Gateway is affected.
A remote server can return a specially crafted response to trigger a buffer overflow in the processing of DHCP options and cause the target dhclient to crash.

Felix Wilhelm, Google Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target dhclient to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Web Gateway (7.7.2.12, 7.8.1.4).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10231

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) Intel/AMD/ARM CPU Data Cache Race Conditions Let Local Users Read Arbitrary Virtual CPU Memory
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Intel, AMD, and ARM CPUs. A local user can read arbitrary virtual memory on the target CPU device.
A local user can exploit race conditions in CPU data cache processing to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. This can be exploited to read arbitrary virtual memory on the target system, including by a local user on a guest operating system of a virtual machine to read arbitrary memory from other guest systems, the host operating system, and the hypervisor.

In certain cases, a local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit several flaws in the CPU speculative branch instruction execution feature and leverage CPU data cache timing behavior to infer information or read information from various CPU caches.

A local user that can trigger an out-of-bounds index error in an application can read data from another process from the CPU virtual memory [CVE-2017-5753]. The eBPF interpreter or the eBPF JIT engine can be used to create vulnerable code.

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to speculatively execute an indirect branch to leak memory contents from another process into a CPU cache and then read the contents of the cache [CVE-2017-5715].

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to read memory from a CPU cache before an asynchronous permission check occurs [CVE-2017-5754]. AMD CPUs are reportedly not affected.

The Intel Core, Xeon, Atom, Celeron, and Pentium product lines are affected.

CPUs from AMD and ARM are also affected.

CPUs from other vendors may also affected.

The CVE-2017-5753 and CVE-2017-5715 vulnerabilities are referred to as "Spectre".

The CVE-2017-5754 vulnerability is referred to as "Meltdown".

The original advisories are available at:

https://spectreattack.com/spectre.pdf
https://meltdownattack.com/meltdown.pdf
https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2018/01/reading-privileged-memory-with-side.html

Paul Kocher, Daniel Genkin, Daniel Gruss, Werner Haas, Mike Hamburg, Moritz Lipp, Stefan Mangard, Thomas Prescher, Michael Schwarz, Yuval Yarom, Anders Fogh, Jann Horn, the Google Project Zero Team, and others reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can view arbitrary virtual memory contents on the target CPU device [which can lead to elevated privileges on the target system].
Solution:
Red Hat has issued a fix for CVE-2017-5715 and CVE-2017-5754.

The Red Hat advisories are available at:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1346
https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1349
https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1350
https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:1351

Title: Cisco Meeting Server Lets Remote Users Access Files and Data and Other Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote user can access files and data on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can exploit an incorrect default configuration to access internal interfaces and ports and gain access to files and data on the target system.

On systems with the Traversal Using Relay NAT (TURN) service enabled and using Transport Layer Security (TLS) connections, a remote user can invoke TURN credentials to forward traffic to device daemons.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg76469 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: The vendor's CVSS score, advisory title, and descriptive text do not match. The CVSS score specifies exposure to remote authenticated users. The Title specifies remote code execution. The descriptive text indicates remote information disclosure.]
Impact':
A remote user can obtain data on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-cms-cx

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager Flaw in TMOS Shell Lets Remote Authenticated Low-Privileged Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated low-privileged user can exploit a flaw in the TMOS Shell (tmsh) to bypass tmsh restrictions and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target file system.

The vendor has assigned ID 709042 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated low-privileged user can bypass tmsh restrictions and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target file system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K37442533

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Support Tunnel Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the support tunnel feature to unlock the support user account and obtain the tunnel password and device serial number and execute arbitrary system commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf54409 to this vulnerability.

An anonymous security researcher reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-ise

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Director Role-Based Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Virtual Machines
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) Director. A remote authenticated user can gain access to the target virtual machines.
A remote authenticated user can login to the web interface with a valid password and a specially crafted username to exploit a role-based access control flaw and obtain potentially sensitive information for or perform permitted operations on arbitrary virtual machines in the target UCS Director end-user portal.

The Rest API interface is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh53501 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information for or perform permitted operations on arbitrary virtual machines in the target UCS Director end-user portal.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-uscd

Title: Intel SPI Flash Unsafe Opcodes Lets Local Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Intel SPI Flash. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A local user can access unsafe opcodes in SPI Flash to modify the behavior of the SPI Flash and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

The following platforms are affected:

8th generation Intel Core Processors
7th generation Intel Core Processors
6th generation Intel Core Processors
5th generation Intel Core Processors
Intel Pentium and Celeron Processor N3520, N2920, and N28XX
Intel Atom Processor x7-Z8XXX, x5-8XXX Processor Family
Intel Pentium Processor J3710 and N37XX
Intel Celeron Processor J3XXX
Intel Atom x5-E8000 Processor
Intel Pentium Processor J4205 and N4200
Intel Celeron Processor J3455, J3355, N3350, and N3450
Intel Atom Processor x7-E39XX Processor
Intel Xeon Scalable Processors
Intel Xeon Processor E3 v6 Family
Intel Xeon Processor E3 v5 Family
Intel Xeon Processor E7 v4 Family
Intel Xeon Processor E7 v3 Family
Intel Xeon Processor E7 v2 Family
Intel Xeon Phi Processor x200
Intel Xeon Processor D Family
Intel Atom Processor C Series
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://security-center.intel.com/advisory.aspx?intelid=INTEL-SA-00087&languageid=en-fr

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Multiple Bugs Let Local Users Deny Service, Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks, and Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A local user with administrative privileges can supply a specially crafted command line interface (CLI) command to trigger an input validation flaw and cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0211]. A manual reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.

The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0212]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to trigger an input validation flaw and reset credentials on the target system [CVE-2018-0213].

A local user can supply a specially crafted CLI command to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the host operating system with the privileges of the local user [CVE-2018-0214].

A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web-based management interface acting as the target user [CVE-2018-0215, CVE-2018-0216].

A local user with administrator privileges can supply a specially crafted CLI configuration command to inject underlying operating system commands or cause the user session to hang or disconnect [CVE-2018-0221].=

The vendor has assigned Bug IDs CSCvf63414, CSCvh51992, CSCvf69963, CSCvf69753, CSCvf49844, CSCuv32863, CSCvf69805, and CSCvg95479 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise1
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise2
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise3
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise4
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise5
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ise6

Title: Cisco UCS Director Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) Director. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco UCS Director interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg86518 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco UCS Director interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-ucs

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance FTP Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Gain FTP Access to the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA). A remote user can gain FTP access to the target system.
A remote user with a valid username can connect to the management IP address and exploit an FTP user credential validation flaw to upload or download FTP-accessible files on the target system.

Cisco AsyncOS version 10.5.1 for WSA Software is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf74281 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain FTP access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-wsa

Title: Sophos UTM Authentication Flaw in 'confd' Service Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sophos UTM. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated 'loginuser' account user can access the 'confd' service via the localhost interface to obtain a session token and then use the session token to submit a specially crafted request via the network to '/webadmin.plx' to set the root password on the target system.

The vendor was notified on July 21, 2017.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.korelogic.com/Resources/Advisories/KL-001-2018-007.txt

Matt Bergin (@thatguylevel) of KoreLogic, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.508).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://community.sophos.com/products/unified-threat-management/b/utm-blog/posts/utm-up2date-9-508-released

Title: Cisco UCS Director Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco UCS Director. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web-based management interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf71929 to this vulnerability.

Praveen Kumaresh of PwC SDC Bangalore and Ekzhin Ear of NCI Agency Cyber Security separately reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180221-ucsd

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Download Quarantined Messages on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can obtain quarantined messages on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted browser strings to exploit a flaw in the spam quarantine function and download arbitrary quarantined files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg42295 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain quarantined messages on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-esacsm

Title: Cisco Content Security Management Appliance Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Download Quarantined Messages on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Security Management Appliance. A remote authenticated user can obtain quarantined messages on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted browser strings to exploit a flaw in the spam quarantine function and download arbitrary quarantined files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg39759 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain quarantined messages on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-esacsm

Title: Cisco UCS Central Input Validation Flaw in an Operations Script Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco UCS Central. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to the user interface to trigger an input validation flaw in an operations script and execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system. The commands will run with the privileges of the daemon user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve70825 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.0(1c)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-ucsc

Title: EMC RecoverPoint Command Injection Bugs Let Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in EMC RecoverPoint. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user with 'admin' privileges can supply specially crafted data via the Admin command line interface (CLI) to escape from the restricted shell to an interactive shell and run arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-1185].

A local user with 'boxmgmt' privileges can supply specially crafted data via the Boxmgmt command line interface (CLI) to run arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-1184].

Janjua, Mike Erman, Jack Backer, and Alexander Gonzalez from Northrop Grumman reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (RecoverPoint 5.0.1.3, 5.1.0.1; RecoverPoint for Virtual Machines 5.0.1.3, 5.1.1; Advisory ESA-2018-015).

Title: IBM BladeCenter Switches Authentication Flaw in ENOS Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM BladeCenter Switches. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can bypass authentication to gain access to the management interface on the target system in certain cases.

The vulnerability resides in the Lenovo Enterprise Networking Operating System (ENOS).

The following models are affected:

IBM BladeCenter Virtual Fabric 10Gb Switch
IBM BladeCenter 1/10Gb Uplink Ethernet Switch
IBM BladeCenter Layer 2/7 GbE Switch
IBM BladeCenter Layer 2/3 GbE Switch

The original advisory is available at:

https://support.lenovo.com/us/en/product_security/LEN-16095
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://www.ibm.com/support/home/docdisplay?lndocid=migr-5099755

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Web Security Appliance interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf37392 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Web Security Appliance interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.5.2-034).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180117-wsa1

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Central IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System Central. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
The system does not properly limit IPv6 ingress packets. A remote user can send IPv6 packets at a high rate to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv34544 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180117-ucs

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Oracle Linux) Intel/AMD/ARM CPU Data Cache Race Conditions Let Local Users Read Arbitrary Virtual CPU Memory
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Intel, AMD, and ARM CPUs. A local user can read arbitrary virtual memory on the target CPU device.
A local user can exploit race conditions in CPU data cache processing to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. This can be exploited to read arbitrary virtual memory on the target system, including by a local user on a guest operating system of a virtual machine to read arbitrary memory from other guest systems, the host operating system, and the hypervisor.

In certain cases, a local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit several flaws in the CPU speculative branch instruction execution feature and leverage CPU data cache timing behavior to infer information or read information from various CPU caches.

A local user that can trigger an out-of-bounds index error in an application can read data from another process from the CPU virtual memory [CVE-2017-5753]. The eBPF interpreter or the eBPF JIT engine can be used to create vulnerable code.

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to speculatively execute an indirect branch to leak memory contents from another process into a CPU cache and then read the contents of the cache [CVE-2017-5715].

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to read memory from a CPU cache before an asynchronous permission check occurs [CVE-2017-5754]. AMD CPUs are reportedly not affected.

The Intel Core, Xeon, Atom, Celeron, and Pentium product lines are affected.

CPUs from AMD and ARM are also affected.

CPUs from other vendors may also affected.

The CVE-2017-5753 and CVE-2017-5715 vulnerabilities are referred to as "Spectre".

The CVE-2017-5754 vulnerability is referred to as "Meltdown".

The original advisories are available at:

https://spectreattack.com/spectre.pdf
https://meltdownattack.com/meltdown.pdf
https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2018/01/reading-privileged-memory-with-side.html

Paul Kocher, Daniel Genkin, Daniel Gruss, Werner Haas, Mike Hamburg, Moritz Lipp, Stefan Mangard, Thomas Prescher, Michael Schwarz, Yuval Yarom, Anders Fogh, Jann Horn, the Google Project Zero Team, and others reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can view arbitrary virtual memory contents on the target CPU device [which can lead to elevated privileges on the target system].
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for CVE-2017-5715 for microcode_ctl.

The Oracle Linux advisory is available at:

http://linux.oracle.com/errata/ELSA-2018-0093.html

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Network Configuration Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user with guest user privileges can supply specially crafted commands via the administrative shell command line interface to exploit a network configuration flaw and gain root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb34303 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180117-esasma

Title: Juniper Junos Space Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Juniper Junos Space. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0012].

A remote user can send a specially crafted request to cause the target system to include a file and disclose potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0013].

The management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0011]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Juniper Junos Space management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The team at cyberhouse.ge reported the file inclusion vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Juniper Junos Space management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (17.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10838

A local user that can trigger an out-of-bounds index error in an application can read data from another process from the CPU virtual memory [CVE-2017-5753]. The eBPF interpreter or the eBPF JIT engine can be used to create vulnerable code.

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to speculatively execute an indirect branch to leak memory contents from another process into a CPU cache and then read the contents of the cache [CVE-2017-5715].

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to read memory from a CPU cache before an asynchronous permission check occurs [CVE-2017-5754]. AMD CPUs are reportedly not affected.

The Intel Core, Xeon, Atom, Celeron, and Pentium product lines are affected.

CPUs from AMD and ARM are also affected.

CPUs from other vendors may also affected.

The CVE-2017-5753 and CVE-2017-5715 vulnerabilities are referred to as "Spectre".

The CVE-2017-5754 vulnerability is referred to as "Meltdown".

The original advisories are available at:

https://spectreattack.com/spectre.pdf
https://meltdownattack.com/meltdown.pdf
https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2018/01/reading-privileged-memory-with-side.html

Paul Kocher, Daniel Genkin, Daniel Gruss, Werner Haas, Mike Hamburg, Moritz Lipp, Stefan Mangard, Thomas Prescher, Michael Schwarz, Yuval Yarom, Anders Fogh, Jann Horn, the Google Project Zero Team, and others reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can view arbitrary virtual memory contents on the target CPU device [which can lead to elevated privileges on the target system].
Solution:
Red Hat has issued a fix for CVE-2017-5715 for linux-firmware.

The Red Hat advisory is available at:

https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2018:0015

https://security-center.intel.com/advisory.aspx?intelid=INTEL-SA-00088&languageid=en-fr

The AMD advisory is available at:

http://www.amd.com/en/corporate/speculative-execution

ARM has issued firmware fixes for certain CPUs. A patch matrix is available in the ARM Trusted Firmware advisory.

The ARM advisories are available at:

https://developer.arm.com/support/security-update
https://github.com/ARM-software/arm-trusted-firmware/wiki/ARM-Trusted-Firmware-Security-Advisory-TFV-6

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager Unspecified Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Cause the Target System to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted packets to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart, disrupting traffic.

The default configuration is affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 658341 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can disrupt traffic on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (3.1.1).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K37404773

Title: (Blue Coat Systems Issues Advisory for Blue Coat ProxyAV) OpenSSL bn_sqrx8x_internal() Carry Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system in certain cases. Blue Coat ProxyAV is affected.
A remote user can exploit a carry propagation flaw in the the x86_64 Montgomery squaring function bn_sqrx8x_internal() to potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations.

Processors that support the BMI1, BMI2, and ADX extensions (e.g., Intel Broadwell 5th generation and later, AMD Ryzen) are affected.

EC algorithms are not affected.

The Google OSS-Fuzz project reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations.
Solution:
Blue Coat Systems has issued an advisory for CVE-2017-3736 for Blue Coat ProxyAV. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Blue Coat Systems advisory is available at:

https://www.symantec.com/security-center/network-protection-security-advisories/SA157

Title: (Blue Coat Systems Issues Advisory for Blue Coat ProxyAV) OpenSSLX.509 IPAddressFamily Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Cause Certificate Text to Be Displayed Incorrectly
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the certificate text to be displayed incorrectly. Blue Coat ProxyAV is affected.
A remote user can create an X.509 certificate with a specially crafted IPAddressFamily extension data that, when displayed by the target user, will trigger a one byte overread and cause the certificate text to be displayed incorrectly.

The Google OSS-Fuzz project reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the certificate text to be displayed incorrectly.
Solution:
Blue Coat Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2017-3735 for Blue Coat ProxyAV. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Blue Coat Systems advisory is available at:

https://www.symantec.com/security-center/network-protection-security-advisories/SA157

Title: Cisco UCS Central Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Session Fixation Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco UCS Central. A remote user can hijack the target user's session. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can conduct a session fixation attack to hijack a target user's session [CVE-2017-12349].

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2017-12348]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Computing System Central software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvf71978 and CSCvf71986 to these vulnerabilities.

Application Security Consultant Indrajith.A.N reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can hijack the target user's session.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Computing System  Central software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-ucs-central

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance MIME Header Scanning Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send an email attachment with a specially crafted MIME header to exploit a flaw in the Cisco AsyncOS MIME scanner and bypass configured user filters on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf44666 to this vulnerability.

Mai Ngoc Duong reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the MIME scanner security controls on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-esa

Title: Cisco Meeting Server Video Call Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated user can make a specially crafted video call to cause the target system to reload.

Systems with a particular unspecified configuration are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve65931 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171129-cms

Title: (Lenovo Issues Fix for Lenovo PC) Intel Management Engine Multiple Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Intel Management Engine. A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Lenovo PC is affected.
A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in the Intel Management Engine (ME) kernel to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2017-5705]. 	
A local user can exploit an unspecified flaw in the Intel ME kernel to access privileged content on the target system [CVE-2017-5708].

A local user can trigger buffer overflows in the Intel ME kernel to execute arbitrary code with AMT privileges on the target system [CVE-2017-5711].

On hardware systems that have enabled Flash Descriptor write protections, a physically local user can exploit the vulnerabilities in CVE-2017-5705, CVE-2017-5708, and CVE-2017-5711. On systems that have not enabled Flash Descriptor write protections, a local user without physical access can exploit those vulnerabilities.

A remote authenticated user with Admin privileges can trigger a buffer overflow in the Intel ME kernel to execute arbitrary code with AMT privileges on the target system [CVE-2017-5712].

The following processor series are affected:

6th, 7th, and 8th Generation Intel Core
Intel Xeon Processor E3-1200 v5 and v6
Intel Xeon Processor Scalable
Intel Xeon Processor W
Intel Atom C3000 Processor
Apollo Lake Intel Atom Processor E3900 series
Apollo Lake Intel Pentium
Celeron N and J series Processors

[Editor's note: The Intel Trusted Execution Engine (TXE) and Intel Server Platform Services (SPS) products are affected by separate vulnerabilities.]

Mark Ermolov and Maxim Goryachy from Positive Technologies Research reported one of these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Lenovo has issued a fix for CVE-2017-5705, CVE-2017-5708, CVE-2017-5711, and CVE-2017-5712 for Lenovo PC.

Some of the Desktop, Desktop - All in One, IdeaPad/Lenovo Notebook, System x - Lenovo, ThinkPad, ThinkStation, and ThinkSystem product lines are affected. A patch matrix is available in the Lenovo advisory.

The Lenovo advisory is available at:

https://support.lenovo.com/us/en/product_security/len-17297

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Lets Remote Users Conduct HTTP Response Splitting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to cause the target server to return a split response. A remote user can exploit this to spoof content on the target server, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf16705 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary content to be displayed.

A remote user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-esa

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Guest Portal Login Page Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted login data to exploit a flaw in the Guest Portal login page to bypass the portal's login attempt limit and conduct multiple login attempts.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve98518 to this vulnerability.

Mauricio Urizar from Deep Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the portal's login attempt limit and conduct multiple login attempts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-ise

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance File Hashing Error Lets Remote Users Bypass Advanced Malware Protection on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted email file attachment through the target device to trigger a hashing error and bypass the Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) file filtering feature on the target system.

Zipped and archived file types are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf52943 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the AMP file filtering feature on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-wsa

Title: Cisco Meeting Server H.264 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Media Process to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote user can cause the target media process to restart.
A remote user can send an H.264 frame with a specially crafted picture parameter set (PPS) value to trigger an error in the in the H.264 decoder function and cause the target media process to restart, interrupting service.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg12559 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target media process to restart, interrupting service until the process has finished restarting.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171115-cms

Title: Siemens SIMATIC PCS 7 Lets Remote Authenticated Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Siemens SIMATIC PCS 7. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote authenticated user in the 'administrators' group can send specially crafted data to the target DCOM interface to cause the target service to crash.

Sergey Temnikov and Vladimir Dashchenko, Critical Infrastructure Defense Team, Kaspersky Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user in the 'administrators' group can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (V8.1 SP1 with WinCC V7.3 Upd 13).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-523365.pdf

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Manager Lets Local Users Obtain Root Shell Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) Manager. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted command to exploit a string validation flaw in the shell application and gain root shell privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvf20741 and CSCvf60078 to this vulnerability.

Maor Shwartz and Noam Rathaus of Beyond Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root shell privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171101-arce

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine CLI Input Validation Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit an input validation flaw in the command line interface to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

Cisco ISE, ISE Express, and ISE Virtual Appliance are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve74916 to this vulnerability.

An anonymous security researcher reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.4 patch 12, 2.0 patch 6, 2.1 patch 5, 2.2.0 patch 2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171101-ise

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager MCPD TLS Bypass Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can exploit a flaw in configuration synchronization (ConfigSync) to bypass the TLS protections on connections to the master control program daemon (MCPD) and consume excessive resources on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 638063 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K62279530

Title: Sophos UTM Multiple Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users View Arbitrary Files, Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, and Local Users Gain Elevatede Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Sophos UTM. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Configuration Management component does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Sophos UTM interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A local user can with 'loginuser' privileges can exploit insecure directory permissions to set the root password and gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote authenticated user with access to the 'Logging & Reporting' function can submit a specially crafted HTTP request to view arbitrary files on the target system.

The original advisories for two of these vulnerabilities are available at:

https://www.korelogic.com/Resources/Advisories/KL-001-2017-020.txt
https://www.korelogic.com/Resources/Advisories/KL-001-2017-021.txt

Matt Bergin (@thatguylevel) of KoreLogic, Inc. reported two of these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Sophos UTM interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.503) [in August 2017].

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://community.sophos.com/products/unified-threat-management/b/utm-blog/posts/utm-up2date-9-503-released

Title: Fortinet FortiMail Input Validation Flaw in Customized Webmail Login Page Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiMail. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The customized webmail login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Fortinet FortiMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Silas Aitchison reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Fortinet FortiMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2.10, 5.3.10).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://fortiguard.com/psirt/FG-IR-17-099

Title: Cisco Meeting Server HTTP Packet Processing Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Web Admin Service to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP packet to the target Web Admin interface to trigger a boundary error and cause the target Web Admin Server to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve89149 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Web Admin service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.2.4).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20171004-cms

Title: Siemens Rugged Operating System (ROS) RCDP Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Version(s): prior to 5.0.1 (for RSL910), prior to 4.3.4 (for other devices)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Siemens Rugged Operating System (ROS). A remote user on the local network can perform administrative actions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can exploit an access control flaw in the Ruggedcom Discovery Protocol (RCDP) implementation on a configured target device to perform administrative actions on the target device.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can perform administrative actions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.3.4, 5.0.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-856721.pdf

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Attachment Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted email attachment through the target device to consume all available memory and cause the AsyncOS filtering process to crash. As a result, the device will stop scanning and forwarding email messages.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd29354 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the device to stop scanning and forwarding email messages.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.8.1, 10.0.2-020).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170920-esa

Title: Cisco UCS Central Software CLI Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco UCS Central Software. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a command line interface command with specially crafted parameter values to gain shell access on the underlying operating system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve70762 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can gain shell access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.0(1b)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170920-ucs

Title: Cisco Meeting Server TURN Server Configuration Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote authenticated user can gain access to the target system.

The specific impact depends on the deployment model and Cisco Meeting Server (CMS) services in use.

TURN servers that use Transport Layer Security (TLS) connections, are running on the same virtual machine as other co-located CMS services, and are running on the same virtual machine as a Call Bridge, a Web Bridge, or a database node that is part of a database cluster in the target CMS deployment are affected.     

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf51127 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain access to components of the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.0.16, 2.1.11, 2.2.6).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170913-cmsturn

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance AsyncOS Bug in Advanced Malware Protection Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted email attachment to bypass the Cisco AsyncOS Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) security controls on the target system and cause the attachment to be delivered to the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz81533 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can send an email attachment that will bypass the malware protection feature on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-esa

Title: Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution Token ID Reuse Lets Remote Authenticated Users Hijack the Target User's Session
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution. A remote authenticated user can hijack the target user's session.
The system reuses a preauthentication session token as part of the postauthentication session. A remote authenticated user can obtain the presession token ID to hijack a target user's session.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf58392 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can hijack the target user's session.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-prime-lms

Title: Cisco Meeting Server Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Access Controls and Join Meetings
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote authenticated user can bypass access controls and join meetings via a hyperlink.
A remote authenticated user can load a specially crafted URL to join a meeting for which access should be denied.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve20873 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can join a meeting via a hyperlink.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.0.15, 2.1.8, 2.2.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-cms

Title: Cisco Meeting Server CLI Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local administrative user can supply a specially crafted command-line interface (CLI) command to trigger an input validation flaw in the CLI command parser and inject commands to gain root privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf53830 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170823-cms

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance SNMP Polling Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) poll request to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system that should be available only to an authenticated administrative user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve26106 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system that should be available only to an authenticated administrative user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-csa

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance SNMP Polling Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) poll request to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system that should be available only to an authenticated administrative user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve26224 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system that should be available only to an authenticated administrative user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-csa

Title: Cisco Content Security Management Appliance SNMP Polling Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Security Management Appliance. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) poll request to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system that should be available only to an authenticated administrative user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve26202 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system that should be available only to an authenticated administrative user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.
