A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System Invicta. A remote user can gain root access to the target system.
The intra-process communication component uses a default SSH private key. A remote user can use the key to gain root access to the target system.

The following devices are affected:

Whiptail Racerunner 
Cisco UCS Invicta Scaling System and Appliance 
Cisco UCS Invicta C3124SA Appliance

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun71294 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain root access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Scaling System and Appliance Software 5.0.1.3b; C3124SA Appliance Software 5.0.1.2c).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160406-ucs

Title: McAfee Email Gateway Input Validation Flaw in 'File Filtering' HTML Email Alert Generation Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input when generating HTML email alerts. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the McAfee Email Gateway interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Systems with File Filtering enabled with the action set to 'ESERVICES:REPLACE' are affected.

Wesley Neelen from DearBytes B.V. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the McAfee Email Gateway interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.6.404).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10153

Title: Fortinet FortiAnalyzer Input Validation Flaw in Layout Header 'filename' Parameter Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiAnalyzer. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Fortinet FortiAnalyzer interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'filename' parameter of the 'Layout Header [Header Image]' module is affected.

The vendor has assigned PSIRT ID 1624561 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on January 26, 2016.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=1687

Marco Onorati of the Vulnerability Laboratory Core Research Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Fortinet FortiAnalyzer interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued a fix.

[Editor's note: No vendor security advisory was publicly available at the time of this entry.]

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM BladeCenter Advanced Management Module) OpenSSH 'KbdInteractiveDevices' Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system. IBM BladeCenter Advanced Management Module is affected.
A remote user can request the keyboard-interactive authentication option ('KbdInteractiveDevices') to open a large number of keyboard-interactive devices on the target server and perform a brute-force password guessing attack against the target sshd service. The number of password attempts can effectively exceed the 'MaxAuthTries' limit and are permitted to occur until the 'LoginGraceTime' limit is reached or the number of keyboard-interactive devices are used.

Servers that have keyboard-interactive authentication enabled (e.g., FreeBSD in the default configuration) are affected.

A demonstration exploit command is provided:

ssh -l[username] -oKbdInteractiveDevices=`perl -e 'print "pam," x 10000'` [target]

The original advisory is available at:

https://kingcope.wordpress.com/2015/07/16/openssh-keyboard-interactive-authentication-brute-force-vulnerability-maxauthtries-bypass/

kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM BladeCenter Advanced Management Module (bpet66p-3.66p).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=migr-5099240

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Messages, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can impersonate ntp peers. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
A remote user can conduct a replay attack against authenticated broadcast mode packets [CVE-2015-7973].

A remote authenticated user can exploit a key check flaw to impersonate a peer [CVE-2015-7974].

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the nextvar() function in ntpq and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-7975].

A remote authenticated user can send an ntpq saveconfig command with specially crafted filename characters to cause unintended results [CVE-2015-7976].

A remote user can send a specially crafted ntpdc reslist command to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-7977].

A remote user can send a specially crafted reslist command to consume all available stack memory [CVE-2015-7978].

A remote user can send a specially crafted broadcast mode packet to cause the target broadcast client to tear down the association with the broadcast server [CVE-2015-7979].

A remote server can send a specially crafted packet with an origin timestamp of zero to bypass the timestamp validation check in certain cases [CVE-2015-8138].

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an infinite loop in ntpq [CVE-2015-8158].

A remote user can trigger an origin leak in ntpq and ntpdc to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2015-8139].

A remote user on the local network may be able to conduct replay attacks against ntpq [CVE-2015-8140].

Cisco ASIG reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can impersonate an ntp peer.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for CVE-2015-8138 for IBM Security Network Protection  (5.3.1.8, 5.3.2.2).

The IBM advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21979393

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service, View Files, and Bypass Authentication to Modify the Time
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can modify the time on the target system. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
A remote user can trigger a memory leak in CRYPTO_ASSOC [CVE-2015-7701].

A remote user can send AutoKey messages with a specially crafted AutoKey data packet length value to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7691, CVE-2015-7692, CVE-2015-7702].

A remote user can overwrite "pidfile" and "driftfile" configuration file directives [CVE-2015-7703].

A remote user can supply specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7704, CVE-2015-7705].

A remote user can trigger a mode 7 loop counter integer overflow in ntpd [CVE-2015-7848].

A remote user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in the processing of trusted keys [CVE-2015-7849].

A remote user can exploit a logfile-keyfile configuration flaw to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7850].

A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in ntpd saveconfig [CVE-2015-7851].

A remote user can trigger a memory corruption error in the ntpq atoascii() function [CVE-2015-7852].

A remote user can supply specially crafted reference clock data to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2015-7853].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted password value to trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2015-7854].

A remote user can send a specially crafted control packet message to exploit a flaw in decodenetnum() to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7855].

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the crypto-NAK() function to bypass symmetric association authentication [CVE-2015-7871].

Cisco ASIG, IDA, Cisco TALOS, Tenable, RedHat, OpenVMS, and Boston University reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for CVE-2015-7704 for IBM Security Network Protection  (5.3.1.8, 5.3.2.2).

The IBM advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21979393

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) ntpd Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify Time on the Target ntp Service in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ntp. A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can modify time on the target ntp service. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
When ntpd is started with the '-g' option, a remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a threshold limitation flaw to cause the target ntp client to make multiple steps larger than the panic threshold. This can be exploited to set the time to an arbitrary value.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.cs.bu.edu/~goldbe/NTPattack.html

Aanchal Malhotra, Isaac E. Cohen, Erik Brakke, and Sharon Goldberg of Boston University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can modify time on the target ntp service.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Security Network Protection (5.3.1.8, 5.3.2.2).

The IBM advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21979393

Title: Schneider Electric Telvent SAGE Remote Terminal Unit 2300/2400 Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Schneider Electric Telvent SAGE Remote Terminal Unit 2300/2400. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
The Ethernet driver does not properly pad Ethernet frames and includes portions of system memory when sending Ethernet packets. A remote user that can monitor the network can view potentially sensitive information from the target system.

The following Telvent Sage 2300/2400 RTU models are affected:

SAGE 3030M; firmware prior to C3414-500-S02J2
SAGE 1410, 1430, 1450; firmware prior to C3414-500-S02J2
LANDAC II; firmware prior to C3414-500-S02J2
SAGE 2400; firmware prior to C3414-500-S02J2
SAGE 2300, 1310, 1330, 1350, 3030; all firmware versions
LANDAC; all firmware versions
Impact': A remote user that can monitor the network or receive Ethernet packets can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a firmware fix for SAGE 2400. SAGE 2300 is in end-of-life status and no fix is available.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://infrastructurecommunity.schneider-electric.com/docs/DOC-7658

Title: Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
The system uses a default, hard-coded database decryption key that is shared across installations of Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution (LMS). A local user can obtain the key and then decrypt and access data fields in the target LMS databases.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw85390 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can access data fields in the target LMS databases.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160310-prime-lms

Title: Siemens SIMATIC S7-1200 CPU Controller Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Siemens SIMATIC S7-1200 CPU Controller. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can bypass user program block protection.

Systems with PLC access protection disabled are affected.

Maik Bruggemann and Ralf Spenneberg from Open Source Training reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass user program block protection on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-833048.pdf

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Security Threat Response Manager) OpenSSL Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service and Decrypt TLS Sessions in Certain Cases
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Juniper Security Threat Response Manager is affected.
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases by using a server that supports SSLv2 and EXPORT cipher suites as a Bleichenbacher RSA padding oracle [CVE-2016-0800]. This attack is known as a DROWN attack.

Systems with a private key used on another server for any protocol that allows SSLv2 connections are affected.

Systems running versions prior to 1.0.2a, 1.0.1m, 1.0.0r, and 0.9.8zf (released on March 19, 2015) can be exploited more readily.

The original advisory is available at:

https://drownattack.com/drown-attack-paper.pdf

Nimrod Aviram, Sebastian Schinzel, Juraj Somorovsky, Nadia Heninger, Maik Dankel, Jens Steube, Luke Valenta, David Adrian, J. Alex Halderman, Viktor Dukhovni, Emilia Kasper, Shaanan Cohney, Susanne Engels, Christof Paar, and Yuval Shavitt reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted private DSA key that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a double free memory error and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2016-0705].

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted username value to the target SRP server to trigger a memory leak [CVE-2016-0798].

Emilia Kasper of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.

A user can create specially crafted data (e.g., configuration file) that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a null pointer dereference in the BN_hex2bn/BN_dec2bn() functions [CVE-2016-0797].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A user can create specially crafted data that, when processed by OpenSSL, will trigger a memory error in BIO_*printf() functions [CVE-2016-0799].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.

A local user can conduct a side-channel attack against a system based on the Intel Sandy-Bridge microarchitecture to potentially recover RSA keys [CVE-2016-0702].

Yuval Yarom, the University of Adelaide and NICTA, Daniel Genkin, Technion and Tel Aviv University, and Nadia Heninger, University of Pennsylvania, reported this vulnerability.

The SSLv2 's2_srvr.c' code does not ensure that a clear-key-length value is 0 for non-export ciphers. As a result, clear-key bytes can displace encrypted-key bytes, which can be exploited to conduct a key recovery attack [CVE-2016-0703].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

The Bleichenbacher protection for export cipher suites in 's2_srvr.c' overwrites bytes incorrectly in the master-key, which may provide a Bleichenbacher oracle that can be used to decrypt sessions [CVE-2016-0704].

Versions 1.0.2, 1.0.1l, 1.0.0q, and 0.9.8ze and all prior versions are affected.

David Adrian and J. Alex Halderman of the University of Michigan reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can trigger an out-of-bounds memory write error in doapr_outch() in 'crypto/bio/b_print.c' to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2016-2842].

Guido Vranken reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for CVE-2016-0800 (2014.6.r4, 2013.2.r14; pending).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10722

Title: HP Commercial Notebook, Desktop, and Workstation Products Bug in Sure Start Lets Local Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions on the Target System
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP Commercial Notebook, Desktop, and Workstation products. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A local administrative or root user can cause the Sure Start system to fail to recover the BIOS.

The following 2015 models with Sure Start are affected:

HP ZBook 15 G3 & ZBook 17 G3 
HP ZBook 15u G3 
HP ZBook Studio G3 
HP EliteBook Folio 1040 G3 
HP EliteBook Folio 1012 x2 G2 
HP EliteBook 840 G3 
HP EliteBook 850 G3 
HP EliteBook 820 G3 
HP Elitebook 745 G3 
HP Elitebook 755 G3 
HP Elitebook 725 G3 
HP mt42 Mobile Thin Client 
HP EliteDesk 800 G2 TWR 
HP EliteDesk 800 G2 DM 
HP mp9 G2 Retail System 
HP EliteDesk 800 SFF 
HP EliteOne 800 G2 23-in T/NT 
HP EliteDesk 705 G2 MT/SFF 
HP EliteDesk 705 G2 DM 
HP EliteOne 705 G2 23in AiO T/NT
Impact': A local administrative or root level user can cause the Sure Start system to fail to recover the BIOS.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A firmware patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20565.www2.hp.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docId=emr_na-c05012469

Title: Rockwell Automation CompactLogix Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Rockwell Automation CompactLogix (EtherNet/IP). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The CompactLogix web server does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the web server and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The following models are affected:

1769-L16ER-BB1B, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L18ER-BB1B, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L18ERM-BB1B, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L24ER-QB1B, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L24ER-QBFC1B, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L27ERM-QBFC1B, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L30ER, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L30ERM, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L30ER-NSE, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L33ER, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L33ERM, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L36ERM, Version 27.011 and prior
1769-L23E-QB1B, Version 20.018 and prior
1769-L23E-QBFC1B, Version 20.018 and prior

Aditya Sood reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the CompactLogix web server interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

For 1769-L16XX, 1769-L18XX, 1769-L24XX, 1769-L27XX, 1769-L30XX, 1769-L33XX, 1769-L36XX:  FRN 28.011+

For 1769-L23E-QB1B:  Migrate to 1769-L24ER-BB1B

For 1769-L23E-QBFC1B:  Migrate to 1769-L24ER-QBFC1B

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://rockwellautomation.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/731098

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Bug in Web Proxy Framework Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the trusted network can send specially crafted HTTPS packets through the target device to exploit a flaw in the web proxy framework and cause the target device to temporarily drop all requests traversing the device.

The device will return to normal operations automatically.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu24840 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to temporarily drop all requests traversing the device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.5.3-051, 9.0.0-485).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160302-wsa

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System TCP Packet Processing Flaw on NX-OS Lets Remote Users Cause the Target TCP Stack to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A remote user can cause the target TCP stack to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP packet to a port on the target device via a TCP session that is in the TIME_WAIT state to cause the target TCP stack to reload.

Packets sent to the target device via IPv4 or IPv6 can trigger this flaw.

Packets sent via the unicast address on arbitrary interfaces on the device can trigger this flaw.

Traffic sent through the target device cannot trigger this vulnerability.

Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) devices running NX-OS are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCub70579, CSCue79544, CSCuo58749, CSCup97337, CSCup97345, and CSCup97366 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TCP stack to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160302-netstack

Title: McAfee Data Loss Prevention Access Control Flaw Lets Local Users Bypass Self-Protection Security Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Data Loss Prevention. A local user can bypass security restrictions.
A local administrative user can bypass the McAfee self-protection mechanism to access and modify registry settings and files on the target system.

The vendor was notified in November 2014.

Maurizio Agazzini (aka inode) from Mediaservice.net reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass security controls to access and modify settings and files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.3 Patch 6, 9.4 Patch 1 HF3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10151

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Identity Services Engine) Glibc getaddrinfo() Stack Overflow Lets Remote or Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Identity Services Engine is affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the getaddrinfo() function in the glibc DNS client resolver code ('resolv/nss_dns') and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application using the glibc library.

Various applications may be affected, including ssh, sudo, and curl.

Additional information is available at:

https://googleonlinesecurity.blogspot.com/2016/02/cve-2015-7547-glibc-getaddrinfo-stack.html
Impact': A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Identity Services Engine.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuy34700 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160218-glibc

Title: Sophos UTM Input Validation Flaw in 'lang' Parameter Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sophos UTM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'lang' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Sophos UTM software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.halock.com/blog/cve-2016-2046-cross-site-scripting-sophos-utm-9/

Mike Lisi of HALOCK Security Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Sophos UTM software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.353).

No vendor advisory was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Universal Small Cell Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Firmware Files from the Target Cisco-hosted Binary Server
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Universal Small Cell. A remote user can obtain firmware files hosted on the target Cisco-hosted binary server system.
The target Cisco-hosted binary server does not properly validate certificates of Cisco Universal Small Cell devices. A remote user can send a specially crafted request to download the firmware images and service provider configuration hints file (which contains IP address information for the target device's provisioned service provider Cisco Universal Small Cell RAN Management System).

The firmware can be be decrypted if the remote user has previously obtained a valid key from the flash of a Cisco Universal Small Cell device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut98082 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain firmware files hosted on the target Cisco-hosted binary server system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160212-usc

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted email message containing encoded files to bypass security restrictions.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCux45338 and CSCux45950 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160211-esaamp

Title: Siemens SIMATIC S7-1500 CPU Controller Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Replay Security Mechanisms and Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Siemens SIMATIC S7-1500 Controller. A remote user can cause the target system to crash. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to TCP port 102 to cause the target device to restart and remain in 'STOP' mode [CVE-2016-2200].

Lexfo reported this vulnerability.

A remote user may be able to bypass or reduce the effectiveness of the replay protection mechanisms on TCP port 102 in certain cases [CVE-2016-2201].

Amossys reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target system to restart and remain in 'STOP' mode.

A remote user can bypass replay security protection on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (S7-1500 firmware version 1.8.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-253230.pdf

Title: Cisco Prime Security Manager RBAC Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Modify Passwords on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Security Manager. A remote authenticated user can modify passwords on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to exploit a flaw in the role-based access control implementation to modify the password of arbitrary users on the target system, including Administrator users.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo94842 to this vulnerability.

Karn Ganeshen of Cisco Systems reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can modify passwords for arbitrary user accounts on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.3.1.1(112)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160203-prsm

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for F5 Enterprise Manager) IPsec-Tools IKE Null Pointer Dereference Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IPsec-Tools. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. F5 Enterprise Manager is affected.
A remote user can send two specially crafted UDP packets to trigger a null pointer dereference cause the target IKE service to crash.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.altsci.com/ipsec/

Javantea reported this vulnerability at the Seattle TA3M conference.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target IKE daemon to crash.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued a fix for CVE-2015-4047 for F5 Enterprise Manager.

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/05/sol05013313.html

Title: Rockwell Automation MicroLogix PLC Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Rockwell Automation MicroLogix PLC (EtherNet/IP). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request to trigger a stack overflow in the target web service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The following Allen-Bradley MicroLogix 1100 PLC versions are affected:

1763-L16AWA, Series B, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16BBB, Series B, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16BWA, Series B, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16DWD, Series B, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16AWA, Series A, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16BBB, Series A, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16BWA, Series A, Version 15.000 and prior versions
1763-L16DWD, Series A, Version 15.000 and prior versions

The original advisory is available at:

https://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-16-026-02

David Atch of CyberX reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for hardware Series B devices.

No solution is available for Hardware Series A devices.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://rockwellautomation.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/765050

Title: (Fortinet Issues Fix for Fortinet FortiAnalyzer) Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS Undocumented SSH Access Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiGate/FortiOS. A remote user can gain access to the target system. Fortinet FortiAnalyzer is affected.
A remote user can gain access to the target system via SSH using an undocumented account.

Systems with "Administrative Access" enabled for SSH are affected.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
Fortinet has issued a fix for Fortinet FortiAnalyzer (5.0.12, 5.2.5).

The Fortinet advisory is available at:

http://www.fortiguard.com/advisory/multiple-products-ssh-undocumented-login-vulnerability

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user with low privileges can access certain web resources that otherwise require higher administrative privileges to access.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu45926 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user with low privileges can access web resources that otherwise require higher administrative privileges to access.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160113-ise2

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can supply specially crafted HTTP method values to exploit a flaw in the proxy engine and bypass security restricts on the target proxy.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuw32090 and CSCux00848 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass proxy security restrictions on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160119-wsa

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Manager CGI Script Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
The web interface CGI script makes unsafe calls to the shell. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to execute arbitrary commands on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The Cisco Firepower 9000 Series appliance is also affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur90888 and CSCux10615 to this vulnerability.

Jens Krabbenh reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.2(4b), 2.2(5a), 3.0(2e)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160120-ucsm

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun Blade) OpenSSL Alternative Certificate Chain Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Forge Certificates
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system. Sun Blade is affected.
When the validation of a certificate chain fails, the system attempts to validate an alternate certificate chain but does not check the CA flag of untrusted certificates. As a result, a remote user can cause the target system to validate an invalid certificate using a valid leaf certificate.

Applications that verify certificates are affected.

SSL/TLS/DTLS clients and SSL/TLS/DTLS servers using client authentication are affected.

The vendor was notified on June 24, 2015.

Adam Langley/David Benjamin (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for CVE-2015-1793 for Sun Blade 6000 Ethernet Switched NEM 24P 10GE as part of the January 2016 Oracle Critical Patch Update.

The Oracle Switch ES1-24 and Sun Network 10GE Switch 72p are also affected and fixed by this update.

The Oracle advisory is available at:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpujan2016-2367955.html

Title: IBM Security Network Protection Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Authentication Credentials on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM Security Network Protection. A remote user can obtain authentication credentials on the target system.
A remote user can exploit an MD5 collision bug in the GSKit component to obtain authentication credentials.
Impact': A remote user can obtain authentication credentials on the target system.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix (5.3.1.7, 5.3.2.1).

The IBM advisory is available at:

http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21974242

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager Memory Leak in Processing UDP Packets Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP data to trigger a memory leak and consume excessive memory on the target system.

Systems with the management interface configured to provide remote access to UDP-based services are affected.

Systems that use self IP addresses to provide remote access to UDP-based services are affected.

Virtual servers are affected in certain configurations.

Systems with wide IPs referencing certain pool configurations are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 540596 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/00/sol00032124.html

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Flaw in Admin Portal Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Admin portal to gain access to the target device and take full control of the device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw34253 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.2.0 Patch 17, 1.2.1 Patch 8, 1.3 Patch 5, 1.4 Patch 4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160113-ise

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager 'dcoep' Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with shell access can exploit a flaw in the 'dcoep' binary component to gain administrative privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 550243 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain administrative privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/75/sol75136237.html

Title: Cisco SA500 Series Security Appliances Weak Random Number Generation Lets Remote Users Determine TLS Session Keys on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco SA500 Series Security Appliance. A remote user can determine TLS session keys.
The system's random number generator uses insufficient sources of entropy. As a result, the system may generate HTTPS Transport Layer Security (TLS) session keys that are predictable.

A remote user that can obtain large amounts of TLS handshake data can predict the random numbers used by the target device to generate a key pair. With the key, the user can decrypt session data between a target host and the target device.

Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers and Cisco SA500 Series Security Appliances are affected.

The following models are affected:

SA520 Security Appliance
SA520W Security Appliance
SA540 Security Appliance

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCus15224, CSCus15238, CSCus15436, CSCus15440, CSCus15446, CSCus15451, and CSCus15463 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine TLS session keys.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151210-dwvr

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System 6200 Series Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System 6200 Series switches. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can send a TCP SYN flood of packets to the TCP port 22 on the target system while a reload is in progress to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or prevent the reload from completing.

Cisco UCS 6200 Series Fabric Interconnect switches are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu81757 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or prevent the target system from reloading.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151210-ucs

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Central Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System Central. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux33575 to this vulnerability.

Gregory Draperi reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151201-ucs1

Title: (Blue Coat Systems Issues Advisory for Blue Coat Director) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service, View Files, and Bypass Authentication to Modify the Time
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can modify the time on the target system. Blue Coat Director is affected.
A remote user can trigger a memory leak in CRYPTO_ASSOC [CVE-2015-7701].

A remote user can send AutoKey messages with a specially crafted AutoKey data packet length value to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7691, CVE-2015-7692, CVE-2015-7702].

A remote user can overwrite "pidfile" and "driftfile" configuration file directives [CVE-2015-7703].

A remote user can supply specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7704, CVE-2015-7705].

A remote user can trigger a mode 7 loop counter integer overflow in ntpd [CVE-2015-7848].

A remote user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in the processing of trusted keys [CVE-2015-7849].

A remote user can exploit a logfile-keyfile configuration flaw to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7850].

A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in ntpd saveconfig [CVE-2015-7851].

A remote user can trigger a memory corruption error in the ntpq atoascii() function [CVE-2015-7852].

A remote user can supply specially crafted reference clock data to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2015-7853].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted password value to trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2015-7854].

A remote user can send a specially crafted control packet message to exploit a flaw in decodenetnum() to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7855].

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the crypto-NAK() function to bypass symmetric association authentication [CVE-2015-7871].

Cisco ASIG, IDA, Cisco TALOS, Tenable, RedHat, OpenVMS, and Boston University reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
Blue Coat Systems has issued an advisory for CVE-2015-7691, CVE-2015-7692, CVE-2015-7701, CVE-2015-7702, CVE-2015-7703, CVE-2015-7705, CVE-2015-7850, CVE-2015-7852, CVE-2015-7853, and CVE-2015-7855 for Blue Coat Director.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Blue Coat Systems advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa103

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager iCall Script Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user with 'Resource Administrator' role permissions can exploit a flaw in iCall Scripts and associated handlers to create and modify user account properties. This can be exploited to gain administrative privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 525028 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user with 'Resource Administrator' role permissions can gain administrative privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/16000/700/sol16728.html

Title: McAfee Enterprise Security Manager Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Enterprise Security Manager. A remote user can bypass authentication.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted username to bypass authentication to gain NGCP (master user) access on the target system.

Systems configured to use Active Directory or LDAP authentication sources are affected.

The vendor was notified on October 13, 2015.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.quantumleap.it/mcafee-siem-esm-esmrec-and-esmlm-authentication-bypass-vulnerability/

Claudio Cinquino from Quantum Leap SRL reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.4.2MR9, 9.5.0MR8) [in October 2015].

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10137

Title: Siemens SIMATIC Controller Authentication Bypass Flaw Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Siemens SIMATIC Controller. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can connect to TCP port 102 to bypass authentication and gain administrative access to the target system.

Systems with the configuration data stored on the CPU are affected.

The following product models are affected:

SIMATIC CP 343-1 Advanced
SIMATIC CP 343-1 Lean
SIMATIX CP 343-1
SIMATIC TIM 3V-IE
SIMATIC TIM 3V-IE Advanced
SIMATIC TIM 3V-IE DNP3
SIMATIC TIM 4R-IE
SIMATIC TIM 4R-IE DNP3
SIMATIC CP 443-1
SIMATIC CP 443-1 Advanced
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (SIMATIC CP 343-1 Advanced V3.0.44).

The vendor is working on a fix for additional affected products.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-763427.pdf

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance FTP Passthrough Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can initiate and then terminate FTP connections through the target system in a specific manner to exploit a flaw in the native passthrough FTP processing function and consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut94150 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151130-wsa

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Central Input Validation Flaw in Management Interface Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System Central. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The HTTP web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Unified Computing System interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux33573 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Unified Computing System interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151201-ucs

Title: HP ArcSight SmartConnectors Default Password and Lack of Certificate Validation Let Remote Users Gain Access to the Target System or Modify Log Data
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP ArcSight SmartConnectors. A remote user can access and modify log data. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system does not properly validate the SSL certificate of the upstream Logger device [CVE-2015-2902]. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can obtain or modify log data.

The system uses a default password that cannot be changed for the CWSAPI SOAP service. A remote user can use the password to access the system with administrator privileges.

Jefferson Ogata reported one vulnerability (via US-CERT).
Impact':
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can access or modify log data communicated by the target system.

A remote user can gain administrative access to the target system.
Solution:
HP has issued a fix (7.1.6).

The HP advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hpe.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c04850932

Title: HP ArcSight SmartConnectors Unsafe File Permissions Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ArcSight SmartConnectors. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Some files executed by root-owned processes are owned by the "arcsight" user. A local user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

HP ArcSight SmartConnectors are not vulnerable if installed as a non-root user.

Hubert mach and Julian Horoszkiewicz reported this vulnerability via US-CERT.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
HP has issued a fix (7.1.4).

The HP advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hpe.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c04872416

Title: Cisco Mobility Services Engine Installation Permissions Let Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Mobility Services Engine. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
The system installs files with incorrect permissions. A local user can exploit this to gain root privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv40504 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (after 8.0.120.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-privmse

Title: Cisco Mobility Services Engine Default Account and Credentials Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Mobility Services Engine. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system includes a default oracle account with a static password. A remote user can login to this account to gain access to the target system.

The account is created at installation and cannot be changed or deleted.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv40501 to this vulnerability.

Jeremy Brown reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (after 8.0.120.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-mse-cred

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Email Scanner Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
The email message filtering feature of Cisco AsyncOS does not properly validate email attachments that contain corrupted fields. A remote user can send a specially crafted email with an attachment to consume excessive memory on the target device until the filtering process restarts, causing the target device to become unavailable.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv47151 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target device, causing the device to become unavailable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.5.7-043, 9.1.1-023, 9.6.0-046).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-esa2

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance HTTP Range Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
The system does not properly free memory when a file-range request is processed through the target device.

A remote user can open multiple connections through the target device that request ranges to consume all available system memory on the target device, preventing the device from passing traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur39155 and CSCuu29304 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available system memory resources on the target device, preventing the device from passing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.8-113, 8.5.3-051, 8.7.0-171-LD, 8.8.0-085).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-wsa2

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance AsyncOS Proxy Cache Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.

A remote user can open multiple proxy connections through the target device to consume all available system memory, preventing the device from passing traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus10922 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available system memory on the target device, preventing the device from passing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.7-151, 8.5.2-004, 8.7.0-171-LD, 8.8.0-085).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-wsa1

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance AsyncOS TCP Flood Handling Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets to the target device to consume excessive memory on the target device, preventing the device from accepting new TCP connections.

The vulnerability resides in the network stack of Cisco AsyncOS.

The device must be reloaded to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCzv95795 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system, preventing the device from accepting new TCP connections.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.7.0-725, 8.0.8-113).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-aos

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance TCP Flood Handling Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets to the target device to consume excessive memory on the target device, preventing the device from accepting new TCP connections.

The vulnerability resides in the network stack of Cisco AsyncOS.

The device must be reloaded to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus79774 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system, preventing the device from accepting new TCP connections.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.5.7-042, 9.1.1-023, 9.6.0-042).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-aos

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Certificate Generation Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can supply specially crafted argument values to exploit an input validation flaw in the certificate generation process in the admin web interface and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus83445 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.8-113, 8.5.3-051, 8.7.0-171-LD, 8.8.0-085).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151104-wsa

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Blade Server Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Version Number Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System Blade Server. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted URL request to obtain potentially sensitive information from the target system, including the software version number.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw87226 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151102-ucs

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager Datastor Kernel Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user that can upload and execute customized code may be able to trigger a flaw in the Datastor kernel to cause denial of service conditions or gain administrative access.

The vendor has assigned ID 550231 to this vulnerability.

Francois Goichon of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/400/sol17407.html

Title: (BlueCat Networks Issues Fix for Adonis) BIND DNSSEC Key Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. Adonis is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted query to the target validating resolver that requires a response from a remote zone. The remote zone DNS server can return a specially crafted DNSSEC key to the target validating resolver to trigger an error in 'buffer.c' and cause the DNS service to crash.

Hanno Bock from the Fuzzing Project reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
BlueCat Networks has issued a fix for Adonis (see KB #07031).

The BlueCat Networks advisory is available at:

https://www.bluecatnetworks.com/services-support/support/security-vulnerability-updates/#2015

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Computing System Central) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service, View Files, and Bypass Authentication to Modify the Time
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can modify the time on the target system. Cisco Unified Computing System Central is affected.
A remote user can trigger a memory leak in CRYPTO_ASSOC [CVE-2015-7701].

A remote user can send AutoKey messages with a specially crafted AutoKey data packet length value to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7691, CVE-2015-7692, CVE-2015-7702].

A remote user can overwrite "pidfile" and "driftfile" configuration file directives [CVE-2015-7703].

A remote user can supply specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7704, CVE-2015-7705].

A remote user can trigger a mode 7 loop counter integer overflow in ntpd [CVE-2015-7848].

A remote user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in the processing of trusted keys [CVE-2015-7849].

A remote user can exploit a logfile-keyfile configuration flaw to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7850].

A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in ntpd saveconfig [CVE-2015-7851].

A remote user can trigger a memory corruption error in the ntpq atoascii() function [CVE-2015-7852].

A remote user can supply specially crafted reference clock data to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2015-7853].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted password value to trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2015-7854].

A remote user can send a specially crafted control packet message to exploit a flaw in decodenetnum() to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7855].

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the crypto-NAK() function to bypass symmetric association authentication [CVE-2015-7871].

Cisco ASIG, IDA, Cisco TALOS, Tenable, RedHat, OpenVMS, and Boston University reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuw84719 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151021-ntp

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Enterprise Content Delivery System) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service, View Files, and Bypass Authentication to Modify the Time
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can modify the time on the target system. Cisco Enterprise Content Delivery System is affected.
A remote user can trigger a memory leak in CRYPTO_ASSOC [CVE-2015-7701].

A remote user can send AutoKey messages with a specially crafted AutoKey data packet length value to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7691, CVE-2015-7692, CVE-2015-7702].

A remote user can overwrite "pidfile" and "driftfile" configuration file directives [CVE-2015-7703].

A remote user can supply specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7704, CVE-2015-7705].

A remote user can trigger a mode 7 loop counter integer overflow in ntpd [CVE-2015-7848].

A remote user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in the processing of trusted keys [CVE-2015-7849].

A remote user can exploit a logfile-keyfile configuration flaw to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7850].

A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in ntpd saveconfig [CVE-2015-7851].

A remote user can trigger a memory corruption error in the ntpq atoascii() function [CVE-2015-7852].

A remote user can supply specially crafted reference clock data to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2015-7853].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted password value to trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2015-7854].

A remote user can send a specially crafted control packet message to exploit a flaw in decodenetnum() to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7855].

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the crypto-NAK() function to bypass symmetric association authentication [CVE-2015-7871].

Cisco ASIG, IDA, Cisco TALOS, Tenable, RedHat, OpenVMS, and Boston University reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCuw84791 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151021-ntp

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Proventia Network Enterprise Scanner) BIND OpenPGP Key Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target DNS Service to Terminate
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. IBM Proventia Network Enterprise Scanner is affected.
A remote user can return a specially crafted response to a query from the target server to trigger a boundary validation flaw in 'openpgpkey_61.c' and cause the target named service to terminate.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to terminate.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Proventia Network Enterprise Scanner (2.3.0.2-ISS-ES-IF010).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21968076

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Proventia Network Enterprise Scanner) BIND DNSSEC Key Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. IBM Proventia Network Enterprise Scanner is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted query to the target validating resolver that requires a response from a remote zone. The remote zone DNS server can return a specially crafted DNSSEC key to the target validating resolver to trigger an error in 'buffer.c' and cause the DNS service to crash.

Hanno Bock from the Fuzzing Project reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Proventia Network Enterprise Scanner (2.3.0.2-ISS-ES-IF010).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21968076

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) Net-snmp SNMP Trap Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Crash snmptrapd
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
On systems where snmptrapd is started with the '-OQ' option, a remote user can send a specially crafted SNMP trap where the specified object type does not match the type defined in the MIB to cause the target snmptrapd service to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target snmptrapd to crash.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Security Network Protection (5.2.0.0-ISS-XGS-All-Models-Hotfix-FP0012, 5.3.1.5).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21965877

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) Libuser Bugs Let Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Libuser. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the userhelper program to add linefeed characters in the middle of '/etc/password' records, causing the file to become corrupt [CVE-2015-3245].

A local user can exploit a flaw in the way libuser updates the '/etc/passwd' file to gain root privileges on the target system [CVE-2015-3246].

Qualys reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A local user can corrupt the '/etc/password' file to cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for IBM Security Network Protection (5.2.0.0-ISS-XGS-All-Models-Hotfix-FP0012, 5.3.1.5).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21964539

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) Apache Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apache. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. The impact of some vulnerabilities was not specified. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
A remote user can trigger a crash with ErrorDocument 400 pointing to a local URL-path with the INCLUDES filter active [CVE-2015-0253]. Versions 2.4.11 and after are affected. The vendor has assigned PR 57531 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted websockets ping to trigger a flaw in mod_lua and cause the target child process to crash [CVE-2015-0228]. The vulnerability occurs when the ping is received and then a script calls the r:wsupgrade() function.

A remote user can trigger a chunk header parsing flaw in apr_brigade_flatten() [CVE-2015-3183]. The impact was not specified.

A remote user can trigger an unspecified flaw in ap_some_auth_required() [CVE-2015-3185]. The impact was not specified.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for CVE-2015-3183 for IBM Security Network Protection (5.2.0.0-ISS-XGS-All-Models-Hotfix-FP0012, 5.3.1.5).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21967057

Title: (IBM Issues Fix for IBM Security Network Protection) libcurl Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in cURL. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. IBM Security Network Protection is affected.
When the system authenticates to a host using NTLM HTTP authentication, the system may re-use the NTLM HTTP credentials when later connecting to the same host via HTTP [CVE-2015-3143]. Paras Sethia reported this vulnerability.

A remote or local user can supply a specially crafted zero-length hostname to the application using libcurl to trigger a crash or code execution [CVE-2015-3144]. Hanno Bock reported this vulnerability.

A remote user local user can supply a specially crafted cookie value to the application using libcurl to trigger a crash or code execution [CVE-2015-3145]. Hanno Bock reported this vulnerability.

When 'Negotiate' authenticated connections are used, libcur may authenticate the entire connection rather than specific HTTP requests [CVE-2015-3148]. Isaac Boukris reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix for CVE-2015-3143 and CVE-2015-3148 for IBM Security Network Protection (5.2.0.0-ISS-XGS-All-Models-Hotfix-FP0012, 5.3.1.5).

The IBM advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21966972

Title: Siemens Rugged Operating System (ROS) Ethernet Frame Padding Bug Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Obtain Potentially Sensitive VLAN Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Siemens Rugged Operating System (ROS). A remote user on the local network can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
The system does not properly pad unused portions of Ethernet frames with null bytes. A remote user on the local network can monitor the frames to view potentially sensitive portions of network traffic of other VLANs.

David Formby and Raheem Beyah of Georgia Tech (via ICS-CERT) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive portions of network traffic of other VLANs.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.2.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/cert/pool/cert/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-921524.pdf

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos Space) Xen Heap Overflow in QEMU PCNET Controller Lets Local Guest Users Gain Privileges on the Host System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Xen. A local user on a guest system can obtain  privileges on the target host system. Juniper Junos Space is affected.
A local user on a guest system can exploit a flaw in the QEMU PCNET device controller and trigger a heap overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target host system with the privileges of the QEMU process.

A user can send a specially crafted frame marked as TXSTATUS_STARTPACKET but not TXSTATUS_ENDPACKET and then a frame marked as TXSTATUS_DEVICEOWNS but without the TXSTATUS_STARTPACKET bits to trigger the overflow.

A guest system that has access to an emulated PCNET network device (e.g. with "model=pcnet" in the VIF configuration) can exploit this flaw.

Systems running x86 HVM guests without stubdomains and that have been configured to use the PCNET emulated driver model are affected.

The default configuration is not affected.

Systems running only PV guests are not affected.

ARM systems are not affected.

Matt Tait of Google reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user on a guest system can obtain  privileges on the target host system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos Space (15.1R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10698

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the MySQL Server Optimizer component to cause partial denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-4757].

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the MySQL Server Firewall component to cause partial denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-4767].
