Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Unspecified Error Lets Remote Users Obtain the Backup Password
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can obtain the backup password.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request to exploit a flaw in the periodic backup function and obtain the password used to encrypt the backup.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur41673 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain the backup password.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8017

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Other User Accounts
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can access and modify account information.
A remote authenticated user from one sponsor can exploit a flaw in the Sponsor Portal to gain access to guest accounts created from a different sponsor account. The user can modify the login and account details.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur64400 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain access to and modify guest accounts created under a different sponsor account.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8015

Title: Cisco Enterprise Content Delivery System Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users View Arbitrary Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Enterprise Content Delivery System. A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request containing directory traversal characters to view arbitrary files on target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo90148 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8019

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data via the console to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

Egidio Romano, Secunia Research, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20141216_00

Title: Cisco Prime Security Manager Input Validation Flaw in Access Polices and Device Summary Dashboard Pages Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Security Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Access Polices and Device Summary Dashboard pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Prime Security Manager web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq80661 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Prime Security Manager web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3364

Title: (BlueCat Issues Fix for Adonis) ISC BIND Resolver Resource Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. BlueCat Adonis is affected.
A remote user can send queries for domains that are in certain configurations (e.g., with difficult to resolve domain names) to consume excessive resources on the target system. This may cause the target 'named' service to crash.

Recursive resolvers are affected.

Authoritative servers may be affected if a remote user has control of a delegation traversed by the authoritative server in servicing the zone.

Florian Maury of ANSSI reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive resource consumption on the target system, which may cause the target 'named' service to crash.
Solution:
BlueCat has issued a fix for BlueCat Adonis (KB-3935).

The BlueCat advisory is available at:

https://www.bluecatnetworks.com/support/security_updates/2014

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Logging Bug Lets Remote Users View Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A remote user can view potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can view exploit a flaw in the system logs to view potentially sensitive information stored in certain log files.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur99239 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8009

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Cisco Integrated Management Controller Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System in the Cisco Integrated Management Controller. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can submit specially crafted commands to exploit a flaw in the Cisco Integrated Management Controller map-nfs command to obtain shell access on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup05998 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8003

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for SIMATIC CP 1543-1) OpenSSL SSL/TLS Weak Key Man-in-the-Middle Attack Lets Remote Users Decrypt and Modify Data
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data. Siemens SIMATIC CP 1543-1 is affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between an affected client and an affected server can use a specially crafted handshake to cause the system to use a weak key.

Server versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta1 are affected.

All client versions are affected.

The vendor was notified on May 1, 2014.

KIKUCHI Masashi (Lepidum Co. Ltd.) reported this vulnerability via JPCERT/CC.
Impact': A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for SIMATIC CP 1543-1 (1.1.25).

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-234763.pdf

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for SIMATIC S7-1500) OpenSSL SSL/TLS Weak Key Man-in-the-Middle Attack Lets Remote Users Decrypt and Modify Data
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data. Siemens SIMATIC S7-1500 is affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between an affected client and an affected server can use a specially crafted handshake to cause the system to use a weak key.

Server versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta1 are affected.

All client versions are affected.

The vendor was notified on May 1, 2014.

KIKUCHI Masashi (Lepidum Co. Ltd.) reported this vulnerability via JPCERT/CC.
Impact': A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for SIMATIC S7-1500 (1.6).

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-234763.pdf

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for SIMATIC CP1543-1) OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Siemens SIMATIC CP1543-1 is affected.
A remote client or server can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vulnerability was introduced to the source code in December 2011 and to release version 1.0.1 in March 2012.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for SIMATIC CP1543-1 (version 1.1.22).

SIMATIC CP1543-1 is affected when FTPS active.

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-635659.pdf

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for SIMATIC S7-1500) OpenSSL ssl3_read_bytes() and Anonymous ECDH Ciphersuite Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Siemens SIMATIC S7-1500 is affected by one vulnerability.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a race condition in ssl3_read_bytes() and inject data across sessions or cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2010-5298]. Multithreaded applications are affected on versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 when SSL_MODE_RELEASE_BUFFERS is enabled.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on TLS clients that have enabled ECDH ciphersuites [CVE-2014-3470].

The vendor was notified on May 28, 2014.

Felix Grobert and Ivan Fratric at Google reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can inject data across sessions.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for CVE-2010-5298 for SIMATIC S7-1500 (1.6).

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-234763.pdf

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for SIMATIC S7-1500) OpenSSL Null Pointer Dereference in do_ssl3_write() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. SIMATIC S7-1500 is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a null pointer dereference in do_ssl3_write() and cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in 'ssl/s3_pkt.c'.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for SIMATIC S7-1500 (1.6).

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-234763.pdf

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for Rugged Operating System on Linux) OpenSSL SSL/TLS Weak Key Man-in-the-Middle Attack Lets Remote Users Decrypt and Modify Data
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data. Siemens Rugged Operating System on Linux is affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between an affected client and an affected server can use a specially crafted handshake to cause the system to use a weak key.

Server versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta1 are affected.

All client versions are affected.

The vendor was notified on May 1, 2014.

KIKUCHI Masashi (Lepidum Co. Ltd.) reported this vulnerability via JPCERT/CC.
Impact': A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for Rugged Operating System on Linux (ROX) (1.16.1; 2.6.0 with Crossbow 4.2.3).

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-234763.pdf

Title: (Siemens Issues Fix for SIMATIC S7-1500) OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. SIMATIC S7-1500 is affected.
A remote client or server can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vulnerability was introduced to the source code in December 2011 and to release version 1.0.1 in March 2012.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
Siemens has issued a fix for SIMATIC S7-1500 (version 1.5.1).

SIMATIC S7-1500 is affected when HTTPS active.

The Siemens advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-635659.pdf

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System ping6 and traceroute6 Command Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (Managed). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can issue a specially crafted ping6 or traceroute6 command-line interface command to gain shell access on the target system.

Cisco Unified Computing System B-Series Blade Servers are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq38176 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain shell access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7989

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager XML External Entity Processing Flaw in Configuration Utility Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote authenticated user can submit an XML request containing a specially crafted XML external entity reference to access potentially sensitive information on the target system or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

The vendor has assigned IDs 477590 and 477591 to this vulnerability.

The original advisories are available at:

https://www.portcullis-security.com/security-research-and-downloads/security-advisories/cve-2014-6032/

https://www.portcullis-security.com/security-research-and-downloads/security-advisories/cve-2014-6033/

Oliver Gruskovnjak of Portcullis, Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/600/sol15605.html

Title: Blue Coat Director SSL 3.0 Protocol Downgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat Director. A remote user can decrypt SSL sessions in certain cases.
A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is referred to as the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") vulnerability.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the SSL implementation.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.openssl.org/~bodo/ssl-poodle.pdf

Bodo Moller, Thai Duong, and Krzysztof Kotowicz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL sessions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix for version 6.1.x.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa83

Title: Blue Coat PacketShaper SSL 3.0 Protocol Downgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL Traffic
Description:

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for PacketShaper S-Series) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaws Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. PacketShaper S-Series is affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for PacketShaper S-Series (11.1.1.24).

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa82

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. HP Integrity Server is affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
HP has issued a fix for CVE-2014-6271, CVE-2014-6277, CVE-2014-6278, and CVE-2014-7169 for HP Integrity Superdome X and HP ConvergedSystem 900 for SAP HANA and for HP Integrity SD2 CB900s i4 & i2 Server.

The HP advisories HPSBHF03145 and HPSBHF03146 are available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04479505-1

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04479601-1

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance AsyncOS ZIP File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass the Protection Engine
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass the protection engine.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ZIP file that will exploit a detection flaw in the ZIP inspection engine of Cisco AsyncOS for Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) and bypass the protection mechanism.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup07934 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can send a zip file that will bypass the protection engine.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3381

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for CVE-2014-6271 and CVE-2014-7169 for Cisco Prime Security Manager.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur05701 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for Blue Coat Director) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaws Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Blue Coat Director is affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for Blue Coat Director.

A patch is available for version 6.1.14.1 and later for Director-500 and Director-VA.

A patch will not be issued for version 5.5.x.

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa82

The Check Point advisory is available at:

https://supportcenter.checkpoint.com/supportcenter/portal?solutionid=sk102673

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10648

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Computing System) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaw Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Unified Computing System is affected. The impact may vary.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Unified Computing System.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur01379 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system

Description:

The software does not properly process environment variables.
