Title: Cisco Unified Computing System E-Series Blade Servers SSH Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): E-Series Blade Servers; Cisco IMC versions prior to 2.3.1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System E-Series Blade Servers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SSH packet to the SSH service on the target Cisco Integrated Management Controller (Cisco IMC) to cause the Cisco IMC to become unresponsive.

The operating system running on the target blade is not affected.

The Cisco IMC cannot be restarted from the IOS command line interface or via IPMI.

To return the system to normal operation, the target E-Series Server likely must be restarted by switching the blade's power switch or by restarting the ISR G2 router that the device is installed in. 

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo69206 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Cisco IMC to become unresponsive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140908-ucse

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager ConfigSync Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Read and Write Arbitrary Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote user can read from or write to arbitrary files on the target system.
A remote user can connect to the rsync service on TCP port 873 to read from or write to arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 458827 to this vulnerability.

Thomas Hibbert of Security Assessment reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can read from or write to arbitrary files on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.1.1 HF2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/200/sol15236.html?sr=39957865

Title: IBM Security Network Protection SSL Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM Security Network Protection. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SSL messages to cause a single thread to enter a loop and consume excessive CPU resources in certain cases. This may cause the target device to become unresponsive.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system, which may cause the system to become unresponsive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21680803

Title: HP PC UEFI Firmware Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP PCs with UEFI Firmware. A local user can obtain full control of the target system.
A local user can exploit flaws in the EDK2 Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A buffer overflow may occur in during the Drive Execution Environment (DXE) phase of the UEFI boot process [CVE-2014-4859].

A memory write error may occur during the Pre-EFI Initialization (PEI) phase of the UEFI boot process [CVE-2014-4860].

Additional information is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/552286

Corey Kallenberg, Xeno Kovah, Sam Cornwell, and John Butterworth of The MITRE Corporation reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain the privileges of the target system firmware.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/
docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c04393276

Title: McAfee Web Gateway Accounts Tab Discloses Hashed Passwords to Remote Authenticated Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Web Gateway. A remote authenticated user can obtain hashed administrative passwords.
A remote authenticated user can access the Accounts tab of the administrative interface to obtain hashed passwords for administrator accounts.

The hashed passwords are unsalted and hashed with SHA1.

David Cash from NCC Group reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain hashed administrative passwords.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.3.2.9, 7.4.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10080

Title: EMC RecoverPoint Internal Firewall Ruleset Error Lets Remote Users Bypass the Firewall
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC RecoverPoint. A remote user can bypass the firewall.
The firewall rule designed to drop all incoming connections except connections to those ports explicitly permitted was not enabled by default. A remote user can bypass the firewall function to conduct port scanning or access services on the target device.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the firewall to access ports on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (4.1.0.1; Advisory ESA-2014-074).

Title: Citrix NetScaler Gateway Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Citrix NetScaler Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2014-4346, CVE-2014-4347]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Citrix NetScaler Gateway software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Stefan Viehbock of SEC Consult reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Citrix NetScaler Gateway software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.3-62.4, 10.1-126.12).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.citrix.com/article/CTX140863

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Identity Services Engine) Struts Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify Server-Side Context Objects
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Struts. A remote user can modify server-side context objects. Cisco Identity Services Engine is affected.
A remote user can bypass the '#'-usage protection built into the ParametersInterceptor function to manipulate server-side context objects.

Meder Kydyraliev, Google Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify server-side context objects.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco Identity Services Engine (1.0.4.573-6, 1.1.0.665-4, 1.1.1.268-6, 1.1.2.145-9, 1.1.3.124-4, 1.1.4.218-4, and 1.2.0.899).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140709-struts2

Title: Cisco Universal Small Cell DHCP Client Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Execute Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Universal Small Cell. A remote user can execute commands on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted DHCP messages to trigger a parsing flaw and execute commands on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup47513 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3307

Title: Supermicro Motherboards IPMI Interface Discloses Passwords to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Supermicro Motherboards. A remote user can obtain passwords.
A remote user can connect to the WPCM450 baseboard management controller (BMC) via the Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) on TCP port 49152 and request the PSBlock file, which contains passwords in plain text.

Systems with the WPCM450 BMC and with UPnP enabled are affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://blog.cari.net/carisirt-yet-another-bmc-vulnerability-and-some-added-extras/

Zachary Wikholm from CARISIRT reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain passwords.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a firmware fix for X7, X8/H8, and X9 boards. The X10 boards do not use the vulnerable BMC.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.supermicro.com/support/faqs/faq.cfm?faq=16536

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Command Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The system does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. The 'user.php' [CVE-2014-1650] and 'clientreport.php' [CVE-2014-1651] scripts are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to 'SNMPConfig.php' to inject arbitrary commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-5017].

Some report pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2014-1652]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Symantec Web Gateway interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Brandon Perry (via HP Zero Day Initiative) reported two vulnerabilities. Min1214 of INFOSEC Inc. (via Korean CERT, KR-CERT, and CERT.org) reported two vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Symantec Web Gateway interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20140616_00

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance (IronPort). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCun07998 (for Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA)), CSCun07844 (for Cisco Web Security Appliance (WSA)), and CSCun07888 (for Cisco Content Security Management Appliance (SMA)) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3289

Title: (Siemens Issues Advisory for Rugged Operating System on Linux) GnuTLS Certificate Processing Flaw May Let Remote Users Bypass Certificate Validation
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in GnuTLS. A remote user can bypass certificate validation in certain cases. Rugged Operating System on Linux (RoX) is affected.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted X.509 certificate that will cause GnuTLS to incorrectly report a successful verification.

Nikos Mavrogiannopoulos of the Red Hat Security Technologies Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation in certain cases.
Solution:
RuggedCom has issued an advisory for Rugged Operating System on Linux (RoX). The vendor is working on a firmware fix.

The RuggedCom advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-839231.pdf

Title: F5 Enterprise Manager Input Validation Flaw in Configuration Utility 'list.jsp' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 Enterprise Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The configuration utility 'list.jsp' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in some parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 Enterprise Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned ID 447483 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 Enterprise Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/200/sol15296.html

Title: McAfee Network Data Loss Prevention Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service, Inject SQL Commands, and Conduct Clickjacking Attacks
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Network Data Loss Prevention (DLP). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can conduct click-jacking attacks.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RAR file to trigger a segmentation fault and make the target system unusable for a period of time. The vendor has assigned ID 938810 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database. The vendor has assigned ID 921267 to this vulnerability.

The system does not provide proper framing protection (X-Frame header). A remote user can conduct click-jacking or frame-sniffing attacks to take actions on the target system acting as the target user. The vendor has assigned ID 921270 to this vulnerability.

The following components are affected:

McAfee DLP Manager
McAfee DLP Monitor
McAfee DLP iPrevent
McAfee DLP iDiscover

McAfee DLP Endpoint (DLPE) is not affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.3.2 (RTW)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10074

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Network Data Loss Prevention) Sendmail NULL Character Flaw in Common Name Field Lets Remote Users Spoof Certificates
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sendmail. A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites. McAfee Network Data Loss Prevention is affected.
A remote user can create a certificate with a specially crafted Common Name field that contains a NULL character.  Once the certificate is signed by a Certificate Authority, the certificate can be used to spoof a target site's certificate.
Impact': A remote user can spoof certificates of arbitrary sites.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Network Data Loss Prevention (9.3.2 Hotfix 963587_47041).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10074

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine RADIUS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS) packets to trigger a deadlock and cause the target RADIUS service to become unresponsive.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo56780 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target RADIUS service to become unresponsive.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3276

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul21337 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3275

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Group Name Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email and Content Security Appliances. A remote user can bypass security restrictions.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the the group processing function of systems configured to use Microsoft Active Directory services as the authentication database to bypass security restrictions. A remote user may be assigned a different role then intended.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum86085 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass security restrictions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

A workaround is available.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2195

Title: Juniper Junos Space Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos Space. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
On systems where the firewall has been disabled, a remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.3R1.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10626

Title: RSA NetWitness Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in RSA NetWitness. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
On systems with PAM for Kerberos enabled, a remote user can supply a valid username and no password to bypass authentication and gain access to the target system.

Other authentication methods are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (9.8.5.19; Advisory ESA-2014-027).

Title: Symantec Messaging Gateway Input Validation Flaw in 'displayTab' Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Messaging Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Symantec Messaging Gateway management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'displayTab' parameter in '/brightmail/setting/compliance/DlpConnectFlow$view.flo?displayTab=' is affected.

William Costa reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Symantec Messaging Gateway management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.5.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20140422_00

Title: HP BladeSystem c-Class Onboard Administrator OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP BladeSystem c-Class Onboard Administrator. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vendor has assigned SSRT101500 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security and researchers from Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04236062-1

Title: Cisco Mobility Services Engine OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Mobility Services Engine. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security and researchers from Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-heartbleed

Title: Adonis OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Adonis. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security and researchers from Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Advisory KB-6745).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.bluecatnetworks.com/support/security_updates/2014

Title: Proteus OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Proteus. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security and researchers from Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Advisory KB-6745).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.bluecatnetworks.com/support/security_updates/2014

Title: (BlueCat Issues Fix for Adonis) ISC BIND NSEC3-signed Zone Query Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. BlueCat Networks Adonis is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted query to an authoritative nameserver serving NSEC3-signed zones to cause the BIND service to crash.

Authoritative nameservers serving at least one NSEC3-signed zone are affected.

Recursive-only servers are not affected.

Jared Mauch reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the BIND service to crash.
Solution:
BlueCat Networks has issued a fix for Adonis (see KB-6419).

The BlueCat Networks advisory is available at:

http://www.bluecatnetworks.com/support/security_updates/2014

Title: Sophos Web Appliance Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Sophos Web Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted request to exploit a flaw in the 'change_password' function and modify the admin user password [CVE-2014-2849].

Demonstration exploit code is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/32789

A remote authenticated administrative user can supply specially crafted address parameter values to the 'netinterface' network interface configuration page to execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system [CVE-2014-2850].
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can gain administrative privileges on the target system.

A remote authenticated administrative user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.8.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.sophos.com/en-us/support/knowledgebase/120230.aspx

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server) OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server is affected.
A remote client or server can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vulnerability was introduced to the source code in December 2011 and to release version 1.0.1 in March 2012.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server is affected.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-heartbleed

Title: Fortinet FortiADC Input Validation Flaw in 'locale' Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Fortinet FortiADC. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web administration interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'locale' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Fortinet FortiADC web administration interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

William Costa reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Fortinet FortiADC web administration interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.fortiguard.com/advisory/FG-IR-14-004/

Title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Redirect Target Users to Arbitrary Web Sites
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can redirect users to arbitrary web sites.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will inject an HTTP header to redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary web site.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj61002 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can redirect users to arbitrary web sites.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2137

Title: Rugged Operating System Web Management Interface Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Rugged Operating System (ROS). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the web management interface via TCP port 80 to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

Aivar Liimets from Martem Telecontrol Systems reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause unspecified denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.11.5; 4.1 is pending).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-831997.pdf

Title: EMC Cloud Tiering Appliance Request Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users View Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Cloud Tiering Appliance. A remote user can view files on the target system.
The '/api/login' script does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted XML External Entity (XXE) link to view files on target system with root privileges [CVE-2014-0644].

The original advisory is available at:

https://gist.github.com/brandonprry/9895721

The default passwords for built-in accounts (i.e., root, super, admin) are stored using a weak DES encryption algorithm (CVE-2014-0645). Passwords changed during or after installation are not affected.  

Brandon Perry reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system with root privileges.
Solution: The vendor has issued a hot fix (Advisory ESA-2014-028).

Title: Cisco Prime Security Manager Dashboard Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Security Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The dashboard does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Prime Security Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun50687 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Prime Security Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2118

Title: Cisco IronPort AsyncOS Software for ESA and SMA File Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IronPort AsyncOS Software for Email Security Appliance (ESA) and Content Security Management Appliance (SMA). A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit an database file validation flaw in the End User Safelist/Blocklist (SLBL) function to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root level privileges.

This can be exploited by replacing a valid SLBL database file with an alternate file that contains shell code via FTP.

Systems with the FTP and SLBL services enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug79377 (Cisco ESA) and CSCug80118 (for Cisco Content SMA) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.9.1-110, 8.1.1-013 for SMA; 7.6.3-023, 8.0.1-023 for ESA).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140319-asyncos

Title: Sophos UTM TCP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sophos UTM. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to trigger a kernel memory leak  and consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.109) [in February 2012].

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://blogs.sophos.com/2014/02/20/utm-up2date-9-109/

Title: McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL and Operating System Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The graphical user interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user with reporting privileges can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-7092].

A remote authenticated administrative user with privileges to apply configuration changes can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2013-7103, CVE-2013-7104].
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.6h938402).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10064

Title: McAfee Email Gateway Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL and Operating System Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The graphical user interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user with reporting privileges can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-7092].

A remote authenticated administrative user with privileges to apply configuration changes can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2013-7103, CVE-2013-7104].
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0h938404, 7.6h938726).

No fix was yet available for version 7.5 at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10064

Title: HP Security Management System Unspecified Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP Security Management System. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
No details were provided.

The vendor has assigned SSRT101434 to this vulnerability.

Paul Such and Alain Mowat from SCRT reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.5.0 patch 1, 3.6.0 patch 2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c04156626-1

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Copy Command Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the copy command to gain shell access on the target system with local-mgmt privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul53128 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain shell access on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0730

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Director Default Credentials Let Remote Users Gain Full Control
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) Director. A remote user can take full control of the target system.
A default root user account is created during installation. A remote user can access the command line interface and use the default credentials to gain full control of the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui73930 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Director Hotfix 4.0.0.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140219-ucsd

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh84596 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Email Security Appliance interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3396

Title: Rugged Operating System (ROS) SNMP Implementation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): prior to 3.11; 3.11 (for RS950G); 3.12.x prior to 3.12.4; 4.0 (for RSG2488)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Rugged Operating System (ROS). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the SNMP implementation and cause switching functions and management services to stop.

A manual cold restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

Ling Toh Koh, Ng Yi Teng, Seyed Dawood Sajjadi Torshizi, Ryan Lee, and Ho Ping Hou from EV-Dynamic, Malaysia, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause switching functions and management services to stop.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.12.4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-892342.pdf

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-5012].

The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-5013]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Symantec Web Gateway interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Shaun Bertrand of Creative Breakthroughs Inc, Comrade Polar Bear, and William Costa reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Symantec Web Gateway interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20140210_00

Title: Schneider Electric SAGE 3030 Remote Terminal Unit DNP3 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Schneider Electric Telvent SAGE Remote Terminal Unit. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted DNP3 data to interrupt communications and cause the target service to temporarily consume excessive CPU resources.

The following product versions are affected:

Telvent SAGE 3030 C3413-500-001D3_P4 (Firmware from 2010)
Telvent SAGE 3030 C3413-500-001F0_PB (Latest Firmware)

The original advisory is available at:

http://ics-cert.us-cert.gov/advisories/ICSA-14-006-01
Impact': A remote user can interrupt communications and cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Schneider Electric RTU Software Security Bulletin number RTUSW 13001).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://infrastructurecommunity.schneider-electric.com/servlet/JiveServlet/downloadBody/2966-102-1-4299/SAGE%20RTU%20DNP%20Security%20Bulletin%20123013%200102.pdf

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in NAC Web Agent Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The HTTP control interface for NAC Web Agent does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the control interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui15038 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the control interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0680

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Report Output Pages Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The report output pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui15064 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0681

Title: (F5 Issues Advisory for F5 Enterprise Manager) MySQL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Access and Modify Data and Deny Service and Local Users Access Data
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in MySQL. A remote authenticated user can access and modify data and cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can partially access and modify data and cause partial denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can partially access data on the target system. F5 Enterprise Manager is affected by one vulnerability.
The MySQL Client, Server Optimizer, Server, Protocol, Server Installation, Information Schema, InnoDB, Server Full Text Search, InnoDB Plugin, Server Optimizer, Server Replication Information Schema components are affected.

The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Alexandr Polyakov of Digital Security; Andy Yang; Dana Lane Taylor of the University of Pennsylvania; Dominic Sim, Agus Komang; Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Florian Lukavsky of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab; Francis Provencher
via Secunia SVCRP; John Zimmerman; Martin Carpenter of Citco; Martin Rakhmanov of Application Security, Inc.; Microsoft Vulnerability Research of Microsoft Corp; Paul Harrington of NGS Secure; Pavel Toporkov of Positive Technologies; Ronnie Sahlberg;
Sam Thomas of Pentest Limited; Sjoerd Resink of Fox-IT; Thomas Biege of SUSE; Travis Emmert; and Travis Emmert of Veracode.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can access and modify data and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can partially access and modify data and cause partial denial of service conditions on the target system.

A local user can partially access data on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued an advisory for CVE-2012-3163 for F5 Enterprise Manager.

The vendor advises that, to mitigate this vulnerability, users should not enable remote access to the statistics database.

F5 has assigned ID 429685 to this vulnerability.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/900/sol14907.html

Title: Infoblox NIOS ntpd Query Function Lets Remote Users Conduct Amplified Denial of Service Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Infoblox NIOS. A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks.
A remote user can exploit an administrative query function (monlist) in ntpd to amplify distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks against other sites.

A NIOS grid master (or other member) configured with 'Enable this Member as an NTP Server' AND 'Access control' set to 'Time + NTP Control (NTPQ)' is affected.

Additional information is available from US-CERT at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/348126
Impact': A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks against other sites.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.6.13, 6.7.6, 6.8.6, 6.10.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://infoblox-2.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2624/kw/vulnerability

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine RBAC Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Support Bundle Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can access support bundle information.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the role-based access control code to access support bundle information, which may include potentially sensitive information such as the user database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul83904 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can access support bundle information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0665

Title: (Infoblox Issues Fix for Infoblox NIOS) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS is affected.
A remote user can send a query for a record that has RDATA in excess of 65535 bytes to cause named to exit.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Authoritative servers are affected if a zone containing a specially crafted resource record is loaded from file or provided via zone transfer.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target named service to crash.
Solution:
Infoblox has issued a fix for Infoblox NIOS (4.3r8-11, 5.1r5-16, 5.1r6-7, 6.3.15, 6.4.7, 6.5.2).

The Infoblox advisory is available at:

http://infoblox-2.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/184/kw/CVE-2012-4244

Title: (Infoblox Issues Fix) BIND NULL rdata Field Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Infoblox NIOS is affected.
When a DNS resource record rdata field is zero length, the server may crash or disclose potentially sensitive information.

On recursive servers, the server may crash or disclose some portion of memory.

On secondary servers, the server may crash on restart after transferring a zone containing affected records.

On master servers, the server may corrupt zone data if the zone option "auto-dnssec" is set to "maintain".

Dan Luther, Level3 Communications, reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
Infoblox has issued a fix for Infoblox NIOS.

The Infoblox advisory is available at:

http://infoblox-2.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/233/

Title: FortiGuard FortiAnalyzer Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 4.x prior to version 4.3.7, 5.x prior to version 5.0.5
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FortiGuard FortiAnalyzer. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The system does not properly validate the parameter 'csrf_token' in '/cgi-bin/module//sysmanager/admin/SYSAdminUserDialog'. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will take actions on the target site acting as the target user.

William Costa reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.3.7, 5.0.5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.fortiguard.com/advisory/FG-IR-13-018/

Title: Cisco Security Monitoring, Analysis and Response System Input Validation Flaw in 'Query/NewQueryResult.jsp' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Security Monitoring, Analysis and Response System (CS-MARS). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The '/Query/NewQueryResult.jsp' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Security Monitoring, Analysis and Response System interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul16173 to this vulnerability.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/Query/NewQueryResult.jsp?QueryIndex=0&isLowLatency=no"><script>alert("Vulnerable")</script>

The original advisory is available at:

http://research.smartnetsecurity.net/advisory/-smt-sa-2013-02-cisco-mars-cross-site-scripting-vulnerability

Giovanni Delvecchio of SmartNet s.r.l. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Security Monitoring, Analysis and Response System interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Guest Account Creation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can create guest user accounts to consume all available guest accounts.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue94287 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available guest user accounts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5521

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Lets Remote Users Download Data and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote authenticated user can connect to the management interface on TCP port 443 and execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges [CVE-2013-5530]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh81511 to this vulnerability. Jan Kadijk from Warpnet (via US-CERT) and Stephen Hosom reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted request to bypass authentication and download a full product support bundle [CVE-2013-5531]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCty20405 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

A remote user can download a full product support bundle.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.1.1.268-7, 1.1.2.145-10, 1.1.3.124-7, 1.1.4.218-7, 1.2.0.899-2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131023-ise

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks and Obtain Information and Let Local Users View Files
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A local user can view files on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.
A local user can supply specially crafted parameters to certain command-line interface (CLI) commands to view files on the underlying filesystem with elevated privileges [CVE-2012-4113].

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCtr43374 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against the Fabric Interconnect KVM module to access and modify the video stream [CVE-2012-4114].

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCtr72949 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against in the Fabric Interconnect to capture or modify KVM virtual media traffic [CVE-2012-4115].

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCtr72964 to this vulnerability.

A remote user that can monitor network traffic can establish an authenticated connection with the target KVM server [CVE-2012-4116].

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCtr72970 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack against the Fabric Interconnect to view or modify traffic on the KVM video channel [CVE-2012-4117].

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCtr73033 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix [except for CVE-2012-4116].

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4113
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4114
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4115
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4116
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4117

Title: Sun SPARC Enterprise Server Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sun SPARC Enterprise Server. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
The vulnerability resides in the Sun System Firmware/Hypervisor component.

SPARC Enterprise T & M Series Servers are affected.

The following researchers reported this and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Adam Gowdiak of Security Explorations; Adam Willard of Foreground Security; Adi Ludmer of McAfee Labs; Ajinkya Patil of AVsecurity.in; Alex Kouzemtchenko of Security Research Lab via CERT/CC; Alex Rajan of Network Intelligence; Alexander Polyakov of
ERPScan; Alexander Tlyapov of Positive Technologies; Alexey Osipov of Positive Technologies; Alexey Tyurin of ERPScan (Digital Security Research Group); Anagha Devale-Vartak of AVsecurity.in; Andrea Micalizzi aka rgod, working with HP's Zero Day 
Initiative; Andrew Davies formerly of NCC Group; Ben Murphy via HP's Zero Day Initiative; CERT/CC; Chris Ries via the Exodus Intelligence Program; Dave Bryant of Orion Health; Dmitry Sklyarov of Positive Technologies; Esteban Martinez Fayo formerly 
of Application Security Inc.; HUAWEI PSIRT; James Forshaw of Context Information Security; Jeroen Frijters; Jon Passki of Security Research Lab via CERT/CC; Juraj Somorovsky of Ruhr-University Bochum; Manuel Garcia Cardenas of Internet Security 
Auditors; Positive Research Center (Positive Technologies Company); Qinglin Jiang formerly of Application Security Inc; Rohan Stelling of BAE Systems Detica; Sam Thomas of Pentest Limited; Timur Yunusov of Positive Technologies; Tom Parker of Orion 
Health; Travis Emmert via iDefense; Vinesh N. Redkar; Will Dormann of CERT/CC; and Yuki Chen of Trend Micro.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Oracle Critical Patch Update Advisory - October 2013.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuoct2013-1899837.html

Title: Sun Blade OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sun Blade. A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
The Sun Blade 6000 10GBE switched NEM, Sun Network 10GBE Switch 72P, and Oracle Switch products are affected.

The following researchers reported this and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Adam Gowdiak of Security Explorations; Adam Willard of Foreground Security; Adi Ludmer of McAfee Labs; Ajinkya Patil of AVsecurity.in; Alex Kouzemtchenko of Security Research Lab via CERT/CC; Alex Rajan of Network Intelligence; Alexander Polyakov of
ERPScan; Alexander Tlyapov of Positive Technologies; Alexey Osipov of Positive Technologies; Alexey Tyurin of ERPScan (Digital Security Research Group); Anagha Devale-Vartak of AVsecurity.in; Andrea Micalizzi aka rgod, working with HP's Zero Day 
Initiative; Andrew Davies formerly of NCC Group; Ben Murphy via HP's Zero Day Initiative; CERT/CC; Chris Ries via the Exodus Intelligence Program; Dave Bryant of Orion Health; Dmitry Sklyarov of Positive Technologies; Esteban Martinez Fayo formerly 
of Application Security Inc.; HUAWEI PSIRT; James Forshaw of Context Information Security; Jeroen Frijters; Jon Passki of Security Research Lab via CERT/CC; Juraj Somorovsky of Ruhr-University Bochum; Manuel Garcia Cardenas of Internet Security 
Auditors; Positive Research Center (Positive Technologies Company); Qinglin Jiang formerly of Application Security Inc; Rohan Stelling of BAE Systems Detica; Sam Thomas of Pentest Limited; Timur Yunusov of Positive Technologies; Tom Parker of Orion 
Health; Travis Emmert via iDefense; Vinesh N. Redkar; Will Dormann of CERT/CC; and Yuki Chen of Trend Micro.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix as part of Oracle Critical Patch Update Advisory - October 2013.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuoct2013-1899837.html

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Bugs Let Remote Users Upload and View Files and Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote authenticated user can upload files to the target system. A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can exploit a file permissions flaw in the Sponsor Portal to access files that have been uploaded to the Sponsor Portal [CVE-2013-5538]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui67506 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the file upload dialog to upload a file with an alternate file type [CVE-2013-5539]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui67511 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the file upload management of Cisco Identity Services Engine to upload multiple files to a specific location of the filesystem and consume all available disk space [CVE-2013-5540]. This will cause the administrative interface to become unavailable. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui67519 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the file upload filename parsing routine to upload a file with an arbitrary filename [CVE-2013-5541]. This can facilitate cross-site scripting attacks against web interface users. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui67495 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can upload files to the target system.

A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5538
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5539
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5540
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5541

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Sponsor Portal Permits Cross-Frame Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-frame scripting attacks.
The Sponsor Portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted web frame that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui82666 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5523

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine.  A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
The web framework does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug90502 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine administration interface software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine portal and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:

A local user can exploit a character handling flaw in the remote debug shell in PALO adapter cards to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the underlying operating system.

The 'show-macstats' command is affected.	

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub13772 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

The vendor has issued a fix.

The system contains an undocumented user account with a hard-coded password. A remote user on the adjacent network can use the account to access the FTP service and view and modify files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtg20769 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can view and modify files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.
