Title: Sophos UTM Unspecified WebAdmin Flaw Has Unspecified Impact
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sophos UTM. The impact was not specified.
The WebAdmin component is affected.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.105).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://blogs.sophos.com/2013/08/21/utm-up2date-9-105-released/

Title: Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Frame Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution. A remote user can conduct cross-frame scripting attacks.
A remote user can cause arbitrary frames to be displayed by the target user's browser.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug77823 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary frames to be displayed by the target user's browser.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5482

Title: Cisco Prime Network Control System Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Network Control System. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Health Monitor Login pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Prime Network Control System software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud18375 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/830316
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Prime Network Control System software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Global Site Selector (GSS) Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Global Site Selector (GSS). A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh42164 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the web interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5471

Title: Sophos Web Protection Appliance Command Injection Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Sophos Web Protection Appliance. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A local user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted 'c' parameter value to the '/opt/ui/apache/htdocs/end-user/index.php' file to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system with web server privileges [CVE-2013-4983].

A local user with web server privileges (i.e., 'spiderman' user) can invoke the '/opt/cma/bin/clear_keys.pl' script to gain root privileges on the target system [CVE-2013-4984].

The vendor was notified on August 12, 2013.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.coresecurity.com/advisories/sophos-web-protection-appliance-multiple-vulnerabilities

Francisco Falcon from Core Exploit Writers Team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A local user with web server privileges can obtain root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.7.9.1, 3.8.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.sophos.com/en-us/support/knowledgebase/119773.aspx

Title: (Sophos Issues Fix for Sophos Web Protection Appliance) Apache Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Cookie Data
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apache. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Sophos Web Protection Appliance is affected by one vulnerability.
When the system is configured to use the '%{cookiename}C' log format string, a remote user can send a specially crafted (nameless, valueless cookie) to trigger a flaw in mod_log_config and cause the service to crash [CVE-2012-0021]. This flaw was introduced in version 2.2.17.

A remote user may be able to exploit a scoreboard flaw cause (via an unprivileged child process) the parent process to crash at shutdown [CVE-2012-0031].

When no custom ErrorDocument is specified for status code 400, a remote user may be able to trigger a flaw in error responses to obtain 'httpOnly' cookies [CVE-2012-0053].
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive cookie data.
Solution:
Sophos has issued a fix for CVE-2012-0053 for Sophos Web Protection Appliance (3.7.9.1, 3.8.1.1).

The Sophos advisory is available at:

http://www.sophos.com/en-us/support/knowledgebase/119773.aspx

Title: Cisco Mobility Services Engine Configuration Error Lets Remote Users Login Anonymously
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Mobility Services Engine. A remote user can login anonymously.
The Oracle Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) service is not properly configured. A remote user can connect to a database replication port anonymously via SSL.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue50794 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can login anonymously.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3469

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Discloses Authentication Credentials to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can obtain authentication credentials.
The system stores the username and password of an authenticated user within hidden HTML form fields. A remote or local user can conduct a cross-site scripting or clickjacking attack to access the username and password of an authenticated session.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug02515 to this vulnerability.

David Robinson of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain authentication credentials.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3471

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System 6100 Series Fabric Interconnects Memory Leak Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a memory management error in the 'show monitor session all' or 'show monitor session' commands to trigger a memory leak and cause the system to reset.

Systems without a Switched Port Analyzer (SPAN) session configured are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug20103 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3467

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Guest Portal Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The guest portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine guest portal and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned Bug IDs CSCud11139 and CSCug02904 to this vulnerability.

David Robinson of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Identity Services Engine guest portal, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-5744

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Unified Computing System) Apache mod_rewrite Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apache mod_rewrite. A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target user's system. Cisco Unified Computing System is affected.
mod_rewrite does not properly filter terminal escape sequences from the log file. On systems where mod_rewrite is configured with the RewriteLog directive, a remote user can send specially crafted HTTP requests to inject terminal escape sequences into the mod_rewrite log file. When the target user views the log file with a terminal emulator, arbitrary commands will be executed. The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target user's system.
Solution:
Cisco Unified Computing System is affected by this vulnerability. Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCui59775 to this vulnerability.

No solution for Cisco Unified Computing System was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1862

Title: McAfee Email Gateway SMTP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted e-mail to cause the ws_inv-smtp process to enter an infinite loop and cause the target SMTP proxy to stop responding.
Impact': A remote user can cause the SMTP proxy to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.5 Patch 1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB79117

Title: Juniper Junos Space Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Modify the Configuration and Obtain Authentication Information
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Juniper Junos Space. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration.  A remote authenticated user can obtain authentication information.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-5095]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Juniper Junos Space web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access information acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned PR 884469 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user with read-only privileges can exploit a flaw in the role-based access control implementation to make configuration changes [CVE-2013-5096].

The vendor has assigned PR 863804 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can obtain a list of users and their MD5 password hashes [CVE-2013-5097].

The vendor has assigned PR 879462 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can take actions on the web interface acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration.

A remote authenticated user can obtain authentication information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Junos Space 13.1R1.6).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10585

Title: Juniper Security Threat Response Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Security Threat Response Manager (STRM). A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can inject commands to execute arbitrary operating system commands with the privileges of the target web service. This can be exploited to gain shell access on the target device.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2013.2.R2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10583

Title: (McAfee Issues Advisory for McAfee Email Gateway) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Email Gateway is affected.
A remote user can send a query containing specially crafted rdata to cause the target service to crash.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

Both authoritative and recursive servers are affected.

BIND 9.6 and BIND 9.6-ESV are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued an advisory for McAfee Email Gateway. A fix (7.0.4, 7.5.1) is pending.

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10052

Title: (McAfee Issues Advisory for McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance is affected.
A remote user can send a query containing specially crafted rdata to cause the target service to crash.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

Both authoritative and recursive servers are affected.

BIND 9.6 and BIND 9.6-ESV are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued an advisory for McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance. A fix (5.6.7) is pending.

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10052

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Web Gateway) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Web Gateway is affected.
A remote user can send a query containing specially crafted rdata to cause the target service to crash.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

Both authoritative and recursive servers are affected.

BIND 9.6 and BIND 9.6-ESV are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Web Gateway (7.3.2.2).

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10052

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System CIMC Port Access Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to certain ports to cause the Cisco Integrated Management Controller (CIMC) to stop responding or reboot.

An nmap vulnerability scan can trigger this flaw.

The Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) C-Series Rack Server version 1.4 is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtx19850 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Cisco Integrated Management Controller (CIMC) to stop responding or reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1190

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Flaw in Firewall Implementation Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The firewall implementation does not properly protect some open ports. A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted IP packets to cause high CPU utilization and process crashes on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug94572 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause high CPU utilization and process crashes on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3445

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting, Cross-Site Request Forgery, Command Injection, and SQL Injection Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.
A remote user with access to the Symantec Web Gateway (SWG) console interface can execute commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-1616].

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-4670]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Symantec Web Gateway software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the target site acting as the target user [CVE-2013-4671].

A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-1617].

The sudoer file configuration allows a remote authenticated user with sudo authorization to run unauthorized commands [CVE-2013-4672].

A remote user with access to the SWG console can exploit a Radius authentication flaw to run arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-4673].

Wolfgang Ettlinger and Stefan Viehbock from SEC Consult reported several vulnerabilities. Offensive Security reported the Radius vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Symantec Web Gateway software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20130725_00

Title: McAfee Network Threat Behavior Analysis Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Privileged Access
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Network Threat Behavior Analysis. A remote user can gain privileged access on the target system.
A remote authenticated administrator can exploit a flaw in a system command to gain root access on the target system.

A remote user can connect to the device on TCP port 2601 to gain restricted shell access.

Stephen Hosom from Ohio Bureau of Workers' Compensation reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can gain privileged access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1.3.21, 7.5.3.30).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10045

Title: Rugged Operating system on LinuX Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Models RX1000, RX1100; prior to RoX 1.15.0
Description:
Three vulnerabilities were reported in Rugged Operating system on LinuX. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated BGP neighbor can send a specially crafted Route Refresh message to cause the target Quagga process to crash [CVE-2010-2948].

A remote router can send specially crafted BGP data to cause the target Quagga process to crash [CVE-2010-2949].

A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMP unreachable message to a socket that is already locked to trigger a kernel panic [CVE-2010-4526].

These vulnerabilities reside in Linux components used by Rugged Operating system on LinuX (RoX).

Model numbers RX1000 and RX1100 are affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (RoX 1.15.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.ruggedcom.com/pdfs/soft_history/rox_v1.15.0.pdf

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Hole in Search Form Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The search form of the Cisco ISE administration/monitoring panel does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuh87036 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3413

Title: Symantec Security Information Manager Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting, SQL Injection, and Information Disclosure Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Security Information Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
The console does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-1614]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Symantec Security Information Manager console and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2013-1613].

A remote user can access webGUI APIs to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2013-1615].

Hacktive Security Research and Development team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Symantec Security Information Manager console, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.8.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20130701_00

Title: Cisco IronPort Appliance Bug Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IronPort. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCuh70323 (for Cisco Email Security Appliance), CSCuh26634 (for Cisco Content Security Management Appliance), and CSCuh70263 (for Cisco Web Security Appliance) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3395

Title: Cisco Content Security Management Appliance Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbtitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Three vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Content Security Management Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted URL to trigger a flaw in the web framework and execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2013-3384]. The vendor has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCzv24579 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send multiple specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS request to the target management interface to prevent other users from accessing the graphical user interface [CVE-2013-3385]. A hard reboot is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCzv78669 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted TCP request to the IronPort Spam Quarantine (ISQ) service port to cause the ISQ service to become unavailable [CVE-2013-3386]. A hard reboot is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCzv81712 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.9.1-102, 8.0.0-404).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130626-sma

Title: Cisco IronPort AsyncOS Software for Cisco Web Security Appliance Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbtitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Three vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IronPort AsyncOS Software for Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted URL to TCP port 8080 or 8443 to trigger flaws in the management interface and execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2013-3383, CVE-2013-3384]. The vendor has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCzv69294 and CSCzv85726 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can send multiple specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS request to the target management interface to prevent other users from accessing the graphical user interface [CVE-2013-3385]. A hard reboot is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCzv58669 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.5.1-201, 7.7.0-602).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130626-wsa

Title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbtitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Three vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted URL to trigger a flaw in the web framework and execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2013-3384]. The vendor has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCzv44633 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send multiple specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS request to the target management interface to prevent other users from accessing the graphical user interface [CVE-2013-3385]. A hard reboot is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCzv63329 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a sequence of specially crafted TCP request to the IronPort Spam Quarantine (ISQ) service port to cause the ISQ service to become unavailable [CVE-2013-3386]. A hard reboot is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCzv25573 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1.5-016, 7.6.3-019, 8.0.0-671).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130626-esa

Title: HP Smart Zero Client Unspecified Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Unauthorized Access
Description:

No details were provided.

HP t5565z Smart Client
HP t410, All-in-One Smart Zero Client
HP t410 Smart Zero Client
HP t510 Flexible Thin Client
HP t610 Flexible Thin Client
HP t610 PLUS Flexible Thin Client

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Email Gateway) ISC BIND RUNTIME_CHECK Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service Against Recursive Resolvers
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Email Gateway is affected.
A remote user can send a request for a specially crafted zone to a target recursive resolver to trigger a fatal "RUNTIME_CHECK" error in 'resolver.c' and cause the target resolver to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target server to exit, preventing recursive DNS clients from using the server.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Email Gateway (7.0 Patch 3, 7.5).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB78482

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Email and Web Security) ISC BIND RUNTIME_CHECK Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service Against Recursive Resolvers
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. McAfee Email and Web Security is affected.
A remote user can send a request for a specially crafted zone to a target recursive resolver to trigger a fatal "RUNTIME_CHECK" error in 'resolver.c' and cause the target resolver to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target server to exit, preventing recursive DNS clients from using the server.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Email and Web Security (5.6 Patch 5).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB78482

Title: Symantec Brightmail Gateway Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Brightmail Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The administrative interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Symantec Brightmail Gateway interface and will run in the security context of that interface.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Puneeth Kumar R. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Symantec Brightmail interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.x).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20130508_00

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The load ShockWave Flash (SWF) component does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Computing System software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud15430 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Computing System software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1198

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Bypass Security, Execute Arbitrary Code, Deny Service, and Obtain Files
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can access potentially sensitive files.
A remote user that can access the Cisco UCS Manager Web Console can submit a specially crafted request to the login page to bypass LDAP authentication [CVE-2013-1182]. Only systems configured for direct LDAP integration are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtc91207 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) via UDP port 623 to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-1183.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtd32371 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the XML API management service to cause the service to stop responding [CVE-2013-1184]. A restart of the Fabric Interconnect is required to return to normal operations.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtg48206 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can access the web interface of the Cisco UCS Manager to obtain technical support or local backup files that were created by a device administrator [CVE-2013-1185].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq86543 to this vulnerability.

A remote user that can send a specially crafted KVM authentication request to the Cisco Integrated Management Controller (IMC) of a managed computing resource to bypass authentication and access the IP KVM console of the target physical or virtual device [CVE-2013-1186]. This can be exploited to join an existing, active IP KVM session if the active owner confirms the request or fails to respond to the request within 60 seconds.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts53746 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can bypass authentication.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can access potentially sensitive files.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130424-ucsmulti

Title: Cisco Network Admission Control Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Network Admission Control. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The Cisco Network Admission Control (NAC) Manager does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub23095 to this vulnerability.

Nenad Stojanovski reported this vulnerability via ZDI.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.8.3.1, 4.9.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130417-nac

Title: Cisco Prime Network Control System Default Credentials Let Remote Users Modify the Configuration
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Network Control System. A remote user can modify the configuration settings.
Cisco Prime Network Control System (NCS) uses common default credentials for the database user. A remote user can modify the configuration settings of the target device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtz30468 and CSCub54624 to this vulnerability.

Erik Parker of Amazon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the configuration settings.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.1.1.24).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130410-ncs
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1170

Title: McAfee Email Gateway Third Party Plugin Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted attachments to cause a third party plugin to consume excessive memory and adversely affect performance on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can cause performance degradation on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB77956

Title: Sophos Web Protection Appliance Bugs Let Remote Users View Files and COnduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Sophos Web Protection Appliance. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can obtain files on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request to view arbitrary files on the target system [CVE-2013-2641]. This can be exploited to view configuration files, clear text passwords, and PHP session IDs.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/cgi-bin/patience.cgi?id=../../persist/config/shared.conf%00

A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request to the Diagnostic Tools function to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2013-2642].

A demonstration exploit POST request is provided:

POST /index.php?c=diagnostic_tools HTTP/1.1
Host: <host>
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 92
Cache-Control: no-cache

action=wget&section=configuration&STYLE=<valid session id>&url=%60sleep%205%60

Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2013-2643]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Sophos Web Protection Appliance interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on February 21, 2013.

Wolfgang Ettlinger of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Sophos Web Protection Appliance interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.7.8.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.sophos.com/en-us/support/knowledgebase/118969.aspx

Title: Citrix Access Gateway Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Access Network Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Citrix Access Gateway. A remote user can gain access to network resources.
No details were provided.

Versions 4.5.x and 4.6.x are not affected.

Ben Williams, David Middlehurst, and James Eaton-Lee of NCCGroup reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to network resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a patch for version 5.0.4.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.citrix.com/article/CTX136623

Title: Cisco Network Admission Control Agent Software for Mac Lets Remote Users Spoof an ISE Server
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Network Admission Control Agent Software for Mac. A remote user can spoof servers.
The software does not properly handle SSL certificate errors. A remote user can spoof an Identity Services Engine (ISE) server.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub24309 to this vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can spoof an Identity Services Engine (ISE) server.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1124

Title: Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution Command Line Interface Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the command line interface to gain shell access with root privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue46025 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1125

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Software Command Line Interface Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine Software. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the command line interface to gain shell access with root privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue46001 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1125

Title: HP ArcSight Connectors Bugs Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks, Command Injection, and Information Disclosure Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP ArcSight Connectors. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-2960]. The code will originate from the site running the HP ArcSight Connectors software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can inject arbitrary commands to take full control of the target system [CVE-2012-5199].

A remote authenticated user can partially access and modify data and cause partial denial of service conditions [CVE-2012-3286].

A remote user can partially access data [CVE-2012-5198].

A remote user authenticated user can inject arbitrary commands to take full control of the target system [CVE-2012-5199].

HP ArcSight Logger version 5.2 and prior is also affected by these vulnerabilities.

Michael Rutkowski of Duer Advanced Technology and Aerospace, Inc (DATA), Chris Botelho of Errord Security, Shawn Asmus of Fishnet Security, and TEB Quantum Technology Sdn Bhd (Malaysia) Professional Security Service Team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the HP ArcSight Connectors software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03606700-1

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for F5 Enterprise Manager) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 Enterprise Manager is affected.
A remote user can send a query for a record that has RDATA in excess of 65535 bytes to cause named to exit.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Authoritative servers are affected if a zone containing a specially crafted resource record is loaded from file or provided via zone transfer.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target named service to crash.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for F5 Enterprise Manager (3.1.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/200/sol14201.html

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for F5 Enterprise Manager) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 Enterprise Manager is affected.
A remote user can send a request for a record that has been loaded with specific combinations of RDATA to cause the target named service to lock up.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the target recursive server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Jake Montgomery of Dyn, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to lock up and fail to respond to queries or control commands.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for F5 Enterprise Manager (3.1.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/200/sol14201.html

Title: Cisco NAC Appliance Input Validation Flaw in Web Authentication Function Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NAC Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco NAC Appliance device and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The web authentication function is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud15109 to this vulnerability.

Cisco NAC Appliance is formerly known as Cisco Clean Access.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco NAC Appliance device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-6029

Title: Intel 82574L Ethernet Controller Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Intel 82574L Ethernet Controller, as configured on some motherboards. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target device to crash. A network layer packet (layer 3) containing certain values at certain offsets within the Ethernet frame can trigger the flaw.

A power cycle is required to return the system to normal operation.

Only some (unspecified) motherboards are affected. The vulnerability is due to a misconfigured EEPROM on the motherboard and not in the Intel Ethernet Controller itself. Motherboards configured by the motherboard manufacturer in accordance with Intel's design guidelines are not affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://blog.krisk.org/2013/02/packets-of-death.html

Kristian Kielhofner reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target controller to crash.
Solution:
Motherboards with correctly configured EEPROM images are not affected.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://communities.intel.com/community/wired/blog/2013/02/07/intel-82574l-gigabit-ethernet-controller-statement

Title: Barracuda Web Filter SSH Backdoor Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda Web Filter. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system includes several undocumented SSH user accounts that cannot be disabled and can be accessed from certain whitelisted IP ranges. At least one account can be exploited to gain shell access on the target device.

The SSH user account names are:

root
build
shutdown
product
ca
support
websupport
qa_test

The following IP ranges are whitelisted:

192.168.200.0/24
192.168.10.0/24
205.158.110.0/24
216.129.105.0/24

The vendor was notified on Nov 29, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/fxdata/seccons/prod/temedia/advisories_txt/20130124-0_Barracuda_Appliances_Backdoor_wo_poc_v10.txt

S. Viehbock of SEC Consult reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Definition 2.0.5).

The fix retains several user accounts for support purposes. The vendor reportedly offers a special option (via customer support) that disables the SSH daemon.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.barracudanetworks.com/support/techalerts#40

Title: Barracuda Link Balancer SSH Backdoor Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda Link Balancer. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system includes several undocumented SSH user accounts that cannot be disabled and can be accessed from certain whitelisted IP ranges. At least one account can be exploited to gain shell access on the target device.

The SSH user account names are:

root
build
shutdown
product
ca
support
websupport
qa_test

The following IP ranges are whitelisted:

192.168.200.0/24
192.168.10.0/24
205.158.110.0/24
216.129.105.0/24

The vendor was notified on Nov 29, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/fxdata/seccons/prod/temedia/advisories_txt/20130124-0_Barracuda_Appliances_Backdoor_wo_poc_v10.txt

S. Viehbock of SEC Consult reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Security Definition 2.0.5).

The fix retains several user accounts for support purposes. The vendor reportedly offers a special option (via customer support) that disables the SSH daemon.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.barracudanetworks.com/support/techalerts#40

Title: Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution Virtual Appliance Lets Remote Users Execute Commands With Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime LAN Management Solution Virtual Appliance. A remote user can execute commands on the target system.
The system does not properly validate authentication and authorization commands. A remote user can send specially crafted data to certain TCP ports to execute commands on the target system. The commands will run with root privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuc79779 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Prime LMS running on Windows or Solaris is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can execute commands on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

4.1:  lms4.1-lnx-CSCuc79779-0.zip
4.2:  lms4.2-lnx-CSCuc79779-0.zip
4.2.1:  lms4.2.1-lnx-CSCuc79779-0.zip
4.2.2:  lms4.2.2-lnx-CSCuc79779-0.zip 

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130109-lms

Title: RSA NetWitness Informer Flaws Permit Cross-Site Request Forgery and Clickjacking Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in RSA NetWitness Informer. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-4608]. The code will originate from the RSA NetWitness Informer interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can also hijack a target user's clicks to take actions on the site acting as the target user [CVE-2012-4609].
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target device acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (2.0.5.6).

Title: McAfee Email Gateway Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Denial of Service Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied email attachment names before displaying the input. A remote user can send an email with a specially crafted attachment name. When the target user interacts with message attachments, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the McAfee Email Gateway device and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The software does not properly verify administrative settings for generating email via the Secure Web Mail Client. A remote user that can hijack an active session cookie can create messages on the target device to consume all available disk space on the target device.

Version 6.72 is not affected by these vulnerabilities.

Oliver R. Gruskovnjak of Portcullis Security reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can consume all available disk space on the target device.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the McAfee Email Gateway, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (MEG 7.0 Hotfix 116 for version 7.0.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10037

Title: (Symantec Issues Fix for Symantec Messaging Gateway) Autonomy KeyView IDOL File Parsing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Autonomy KeyView IDOL. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system. Symantec Messaging Gateway is affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target Autonomy KeyView IDOL library, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application using the parsing library.

The specific impact depends on the application that uses the parsing library.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/849841

Will Dormann of the CERT/CC reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target library, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Symantec has issued a fix for Symantec Messaging Gateway (10.0.1).

The Symantec advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=&suid=20121120_00

Title: Sophos UTM (Astaro Security Gateway) Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sophos UTM (Astaro Security Gateway). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Sophos UTM (Astaro Security Gateway) web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The WebAdmin login screen and 'Last Webadmin Sessions' (v9) function are affected.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Sophos UTM web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.004).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.astaro.com/blog/up2date/UTM9004

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco IronPort) Sophos Anti-Virus Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code with Root Privileges and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Sophos Anti-Virus. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. Cisco IronPort is affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target anti-virus software, will trigger a buffer overflow or memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root or System privileges.

Visual Basic executable, RAR, PDF, and Microsoft CAB file formats are affected.

On Windows-based systems, a local user can exploit a flaw in directory access permissions of the network update service to replace certain files and cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system with System privileges.

The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

On Windows-based systems, the Sophos Buffer Overflow Protection System (BOPS) effectively disables the operating system's Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protections.

On Windows-based systems, the software installs a Layered Service Provider (LSP) that loads modules from a low-integrity writable directory, which effectively disables Internet Explorer's protected mode.

The original advisory is available at:

https://lock.cmpxchg8b.com/sophailv2.pdf

Tavis Ormandy reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root or system privileges.

A local user can obtain System privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco IronPort, which is affected by these vulnerabilities.

No solution for Cisco IronPort was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco has described configuration workarounds in their advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20121108-sophos

Title: (McAfee Issues Fix for McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance) NTP Signature Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Validation Checks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NTP. A remote user can bypass digital signature validation. McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance is affected.
The software does not properly check the results of the OpenSSL EVP_VerifyFinal() function.  As a result, a remote server can supply a specially crafted invalid signature on a certificate that will be detected as a valid certificate.  Signature checks on DSA and ECDSA keys used with SSL/TLS are affected.

Clients that connect to servers using RSA keys are not affected.

Client certificate validation is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation.
Solution:
McAfee has issued a fix for McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance (5.6 Patch 5; pending).

The McAfee advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=KB76646

Title: Sun SPARC Server Bug in Integrated Lights Out Manager Lets Local Users Access Data
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sun SPARC Server. A local user can access data on the target system.
The vulnerability resides in the Integrated Lights Out Manager command line interface.

The SPARC T3, Netra SPARC T3, SPARC T4, and Netra SPARC T4 systems are affected.

The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Alexandr Polyakov of Digital Security; Andy Yang; Dana Lane Taylor of the University of Pennsylvania; Dominic Sim, Agus Komang; Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Florian Lukavsky of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab; Francis Provencher
via Secunia SVCRP; John Zimmerman; Martin Carpenter of Citco; Martin Rakhmanov of Application Security, Inc.; Microsoft Vulnerability Research of Microsoft Corp; Paul Harrington of NGS Secure; Pavel Toporkov of Positive Technologies; Ronnie Sahlberg;
Sam Thomas of Pentest Limited; Sjoerd Resink of Fox-IT; Thomas Biege of SUSE; Travis Emmert; and Travis Emmert of Veracode.
Impact': A local user can access data on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, described in their October 2012 Critical Patch Update advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuoct2012-1515893.html

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series) OpenSSL Stored Session Cache Modification Bug May Let Remote Users Downgrade the Ciphersuite
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded. Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series is affected.
A remote client user can modify the stored session cache ciphersuite, which may cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded to a weaker one on subsequent connections.

Martin Rex reported reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for the Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series servers:

Sun SPARC Enterprise M3000 	SPARC: 14216085
Sun SPARC Enterprise M4000 	SPARC: 14216091
Sun SPARC Enterprise M5000 	SPARC: 14216093
Sun SPARC Enterprise M8000 	SPARC: 14216096
Sun SPARC Enterprise M9000 	SPARC: 14216098

The Oracle advisory is available at:

https://blogs.oracle.com/sunsecurity/entry/multiple_openssl_vulnerabilities_in_sun

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series) OpenSSL ASN1_STRING_print_ex() Invalid Memory Access Flaw Lets Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions. Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series is affected.
A remote or local user that can cause an OpenSSL-based application to print a BMPString or UniversalString (e.g., print the contents of a certificate) can trigger a memory access flaw in the ASN1_STRING_print_ex() function and cause the target application to crash.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for the Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series servers:

Sun SPARC Enterprise M3000 	SPARC: 14216085
Sun SPARC Enterprise M4000 	SPARC: 14216091
Sun SPARC Enterprise M5000 	SPARC: 14216093
Sun SPARC Enterprise M8000 	SPARC: 14216096
Sun SPARC Enterprise M9000 	SPARC: 14216098

The Oracle advisory is available at:

https://blogs.oracle.com/sunsecurity/entry/multiple_openssl_vulnerabilities_in_sun

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series) OpenSSL Signature Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Validation Checks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can bypass digital signature validation. Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series is affected.
The software does not properly check the results of the EVP_VerifyFinal() function.  As a result, a remote server can supply a specially crafted invalid signature on a certificate that will be detected as a valid certificate.  Signature checks on DSA and ECDSA keys used with SSL/TLS are affected.

Clients that connect to servers using RSA keys are not affected.

Client certificate validation is not affected.

The Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for the Sun SPARC Enterprise M-Series servers:

Sun SPARC Enterprise M3000 	SPARC: 14216085
Sun SPARC Enterprise M4000 	SPARC: 14216091
Sun SPARC Enterprise M5000 	SPARC: 14216093
Sun SPARC Enterprise M8000 	SPARC: 14216096
Sun SPARC Enterprise M9000 	SPARC: 14216098

The Oracle advisory is available at:

https://blogs.oracle.com/sunsecurity/entry/multiple_openssl_vulnerabilities_in_sun

Title: Barracuda Web Filter Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda Web Filter. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Two scripts not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Barracuda Web Filter interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'Existing Authentication Services' listing in 'NTLM Edit - Host & Domain Name' is affected.

The upload key tab in combination with a specially crafted short domain in 'Upload Key Tab File' is affected.

The vendor was notified on May 8, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=570

Benjamin Kunz Mejri from Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Barracuda Web Filter interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (6.0.0) [on July 25, 2012].

Title: Symantec Messaging Gateway Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Access and Modify the System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Messaging Gateway. A remote user can access the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote authenticated user can modify the application.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2012-0307]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Symantec Messaging Gateway software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the site acting as the target user [CVE-2012-0308].

A remote user can use an SSH account with a default password to gain access to the system [CVE-2012-3579].

A remote authenticated user can modify the target web application [CVE-2012-3580].

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive component version information [CVE-2012-3581].

Ben Williams with NGS Secure, NCC Group, reported these vulnerabilities. Stefan Viehbock, with SEC Consult, also reported the SSH account vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can gain access to the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Symantec Messaging Gateway software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive version information.

A remote authenticated user can modify the application.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2012&suid=20120827_00

Title: EMC Cloud Tiering Appliance Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication and Gain Administrative Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Cloud Tiering Appliance. A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted file during the authentication process to gain administrative privileges on the target device.

EMC Cloud Tiering Appliance Virtual Edition is also affected.

shiftnumbers.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

Cloud Tiering Appliance (CTA) 7.5 and 9.0 with Hotfix ESA-2012-034
CTA 7.3.1 and later with Hotfix ESA-2012-034

Title: McAfee Email Gateway Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Directory Traversal Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can bypass authentication and obtain a valid session ID as the admin user [CVE-2012-4595].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system [CVE-2012-4596].

The Console/Dashboard does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2012-4597]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the McAfee Email Gateway and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Tenable Network Security reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can gain admin privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the McAfee Email Gateway, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.1 Patch 2; pending).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10026

Title: McAfee Email and Web Security Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 5.5 Patch 6 and prior, 5.6 Patch 3 and prior
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can bypass authentication and obtain a valid session ID as the admin user [CVE-2012-4595].

The Console/Dashboard does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2012-4597]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Tenable Network Security reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can gain admin privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.6 Patch 4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:
