https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10026

Title: IBM Hardware Management Console Input Validation Hole in Login Panel Help Link Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 7R7.1.0 prior to SP4; 7R7.2.0 prior to SP2; 7R7.3.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM Hardware Management Console. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Help Link on the login panel does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the IBM Hardware Management Console software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CitiGroup, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the IBM Hardware Management Console software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

HMC V7 R7.1.0 Service Pack 4 (MH01258_0603)
HMC V7 R7.2.0 Service Pack 2 (MH01253_0328)
HMC V7 R7.3.0 Mandatory PTF (MH01257_0513)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www-304.ibm.com/connections/blogs/PSIRT/entry/security_bulletin_the_help_link_on_the_power_hmc_login_panel_is_susceptible_to_reflected_cross_site_scripting_cve_2012_329617?lang=en_us

Title: HP Integrity Server Unspecified Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Version(s): Models rx2800 i2, BL860c i2, BL870c i2, BL890c i2
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP Integrity Server. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
Firmware v26.11 (and prior) on HP Integrity Server models BL860c i2, BL870c i2, and BL890c i2 is affected.

Firmware v26.21 (and prior) on HP Integrity Server rx2800 i2 is affected.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

For rx2800 i2: 26.30 or later
For bl860 i2: 26.31 or later
For bl870 i2: 26.31 or later
For bl890 i2: 26.31 or later

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03450553

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Web Gateway.  A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The 'spywall/includes/deptUploads_data.php' script does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'groupid' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/20123

@_Kc57 reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: Cisco Unified Computing System SSH Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SSH data to trigger a flaw in the Fabric Interconnect component and cause the target service to crash.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtt94543 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.0(2m)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/unified_computing/ucs/release/notes/OL_25363.html

Title: Citrix Access Gateway Bugs Let Remote Users Traverse the Directory, Proxy Connections via the Target System, and Inject Text Content
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Citrix Access Gateway. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can proxy connections via the target device. A remote user can inject text.
A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can use the target system as an open proxy.

A remote user an inject text content.

No details were provided.
Impact':
A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can use the target system as an open proxy.

A remote user an inject text content.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.citrix.com/article/CTX133648

Title: Citrix Access Gateway Plug-in for Windows ActiveX Control Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Citrix Access Gateway Plug-in for Windows version 9.3.49.5; possibly other versions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Citrix Access Gateway Plug-in for Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the Citrix Access Gateway Plug-in for Windows ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

The vendor was notified on July 19, 2011.

The original advisories are available at:

http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2012-26/
http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2012-27/

Dmitriy Pletnev, Secunia Research, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Infoblox Issues Advisory) ISC DHCP Client Identifier Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC DHCP. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS may be affected.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted client identifier parameter value to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target service to crash.

Systems running in DHCPv6 mode are affected.

Markus Hietava of Codenomicon CROSS project reported this vulnerability via CERT-FI.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to crash.
Solution: Infoblox has issued an advisory, available via the Infoblox Support Center website.

Title: (Infoblox Issues Advisory) ISC DHCP Client Identifier Infinite Loop Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC DHCP. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS may be affected.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted client identifier parameter value to cause the service to enter an infinite loop, preventing the processing of subsequent client requests and consuming excessive CPU resources on the target system.

Markus Hietava of Codenomicon CROSS project reported this vulnerability via CERT-FI.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution: Infoblox has issued an advisory, available via the Infoblox Support Center website.

Title: (Infoblox Issues Advisory) BIND DNSSEC Validation Cache Failure Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS may be affected.
On systems configured for DNSSEC validation, a remote user can cause the cache of failing queries to be used before fully initialized, triggering an assertion failure.

Einar Lonn of IIS.se reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution: Infoblox has issued an advisory, available via the Infoblox Support Center website.

Title: (Infoblox Issues Advisory) BIND TCP Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS may be affected.
A remote user can generate high TCP query loads to trigger a memory leak in the processing of empty queues and adversely affect system performance.

On systems that kill out-of-memory processes, this can trigger an automatic shutdown of named.

Kevin Sheehan of Infoblox, Inc., and Anand Buddhdev from the RIPE NCC reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause performance degradation on the target system.
Solution: Infoblox has issued an advisory, available via the Infoblox Support Center website.

Title: (Infoblox Issues Advisory) ISC DHCP Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC DHCP. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS may be affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a small memory leak. On systems that are run for a long period without re-starting or on systems handling heavy traffic, this may consume excessive memory resources on the target system.

Both DHCPv6 and DHCPv4 modes are affected by at least one of the memory leaks.

Glen Eustace of Massey University, New Zealand, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution: Infoblox has issued an advisory, available via the Infoblox Support Center website.

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Input Validation Flaws Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands, Execute Arbitrary Commands, and Change User Passwords
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can change a target user's password.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to and execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2012-2953, CVE-2012-2976].

The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2012-2574, CVE-2012-2961].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to include and execute files located on the target system [CVE-2012-2957].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to change a target user's password [CVE-2012-2977].

Offensive Security and an anonymous contributor reported these vulnerabilities via US CERT/CC.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

A remote user can change a target user's password.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (database update 5.0.0.438 for version 5.0.3.18).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2012&suid=20120720_00

Title: Symantec Message Filter Bugs Permit Session Fixation, Cross-Site Scripting, Information Disclosure, and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Message Filter. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can conduct session fixation attacks. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive application versioning information [CVE-2012-0300].

A remote authenticated user can conduct session fixation attacks to obtain elevated privileges [CVE-2012-0301].

A remote user cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0302].  The code will originate from the site running the Symantec Brightmail software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks to take actions on the site acting as the target user [CVE-2012-0303].

The Brightmail Control Center component of Symantec Brightmail Message Filter is affected by these vulnerabilities.

Ben Williams with NGS Secure reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive application versioning information.

A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (smf_630_p231 patch).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2012&suid=20120626_00

Title: Astaro Security Gateway Input Validation Flaw in Comment Field Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Astaro Security Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Astaro Security Gateway interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'Comment (optional)' field in the 'Available backups' view is affected.

The vendor was notified on May 12, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

http://security.inshell.net/advisory/27

Julien Ahrens from Inshell Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Astaro Security Gateway interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.305).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.astaro.com/en-uk/blog/up2date/8305

Title: (Check Point Issues Fix for Check Point IPSO) FreeBSD crypt(3) Hash Generation Error May Generate Incorrect Hashes
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD. The system may generate incorrect hashes. Check Point IPSO is affected.
When the crypt(3) system call is hashing data that contains a character with only the most significant bit set (0x80), that character and all subsequent characters are ignored.
Impact': The system may generate incorrect hashes.
Solution:
Check Point has issued a hotfix for Check Point IPSO 6.2 (formerly Nokia IPSO).

The Check Point advisory is available at:

https://supportcenter.checkpoint.com/supportcenter/portal?eventSubmit_doGoviewsolutiondetails=&solutionid=sk75640

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Bugs Let Remote Users View/Upload/Delete Files, Execute Arbitrary Commands, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can include and execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can view/delete/upload files on the target system.
The management interface does not properly authenticate remote users and does not properly validate user-supplied input.

A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-0296]. The code will originate from the Symantec Web Gateway management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to include and execute arbitrary PHP code [CVE-2012-0297]. The PHP code, including operating system commands, will run with the privileges of the target web service.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view or delete files on target system [CVE-2012-0298].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to upload files and execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2012-0299].
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary PHP code and operating system commands on the target system with the privileges of the target web service.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Symantec Web Gateway management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can view, delete, or upload files on/to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2012&suid=20120517_00

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Input Validation Hole in 'spywall/timer.php' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. The 'spywall/timer.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Symantec Web Gateway software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user. The 'l' parameter is affected. A demonstration exploit URL is provided: http://[target]/spywall/timer.php?d=4099&l=22665'&profile=40 The original advisory is available at: http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/18832/ B00y@ reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Symantec Web Gateway software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

Title: Sun SPARC Enterprise Server XCP Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Remote Users Partially Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Sun SPARC Enterprise Server. A local user can partially access data on the target system. A remote user can cause partial denial of service conditions.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in XSCF Control Package (XCP) to cause partial denial of service conditions [CVE-2012-1693].

A local user can exploit a flaw in XCP to partially access data on the target system [CVE-2012-0548].

The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security; Andrea Micalizzi aka rgod, working with TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative; Brian Gorenc TippingPoint DVLabs; Dave Love; David Litchfield of V3rity; Edward Torkington; Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Frank Stuart; G & W Laboratories of TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative; Nathan Catlow of Recx; Peter Maklary of LYNX Ltd.; Pierre Ernst of IBM Canada; Roberto Suggi Liverani of Security-Assessment.com; Shrikant Antre and Sunil Yadav of Network Intelligence; Sow Ching Shiong, reported through Secunia; Vishal K; and William Hay.
Impact':
A local user can partially access data on the target system.

A remote user can cause partial denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, described in their April 2012 Critical Patch Update advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuapr2012-366314.html

Title: Sourcefire Defense Center Bugs Let Remote Users Traverse the Directory, Access the Database, and Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Sourcefire Defense Center. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can access the database. A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Sourcefire Defense Center interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The system uses common default database credentials. If access to port 3306 has been opened, a remote user can login to the database with the credentials.

A remote user can download certain files from the web server's document directory.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/pagedata.yml

A remote user can download arbitrary files from the target system.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/ComparisonViewer/report.cgi?file=../../../../../[filename]

If the administrator has created a '/var/tmp/streams' directory, a remote user can delete files from that directory.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/stream/ack.cgi?POSTDATA=foo

The vendor was notified on March 20, 2012.

Filip Palian reported these vulnerabilities
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Sourcefire Defense Center interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can access the database.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (4.10.2.3).

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for PacketShaper) OpenSSL Stored Session Cache Modification Bug May Let Remote Users Downgrade the Ciphersuite
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded. Blue Coat PacketShaper is affected.
A remote client user can modify the stored session cache ciphersuite, which may cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded to a weaker one on subsequent connections.

Martin Rex reported reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for PacketShaper (8.7.1).

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA53

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for ProxyAV) OpenSSL Stored Session Cache Modification Bug May Let Remote Users Downgrade the Ciphersuite
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded. Blue Coat ProxyAV is affected.
A remote client user can modify the stored session cache ciphersuite, which may cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded to a weaker one on subsequent connections.

Martin Rex reported reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for ProxyAV (3.4.1.1).

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA53

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for Director) OpenSSL Stored Session Cache Modification Bug May Let Remote Users Downgrade the Ciphersuite
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded. Blue Coat Director is affected.
A remote client user can modify the stored session cache ciphersuite, which may cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded to a weaker one on subsequent connections.

Martin Rex reported reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for Director (5.5.1.2).

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA53

Title: McAfee Email Gateway Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Email Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
The management console does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can reset the passwords of other administrators.

A remote authenticated user can obtain active session tokens via the Dashboard.

A user can obtain password hashes from a system backup.

A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted URL to download arbitrary files from the target device.

A remote authenticated user can view arbitrary file contents with root privileges.

Ben Williams of NGS Secure reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can reset the passwords of other administrators.

A remote authenticated user can obtain active session tokens via the Dashboard.

A user can obtain password hashes from a system backup.

A remote authenticated user can download arbitrary files from the target device.

A remote authenticated user can view arbitrary file contents with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0 Patch 1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10020

Title: McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in McAfee Email and Web Security Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
The management console does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can reset the passwords of other administrators.

A remote authenticated user can obtain active session tokens via the Dashboard.

A user can obtain password hashes from a system backup.

A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted URL to download arbitrary files from the target device.

A remote authenticated user can view arbitrary file contents with root privileges.

Ben Williams of NGS Secure reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated user can reset the passwords of other administrators.

A remote authenticated user can obtain active session tokens via the Dashboard.

A user can obtain password hashes from a system backup.

A remote authenticated user can download arbitrary files from the target device.

A remote authenticated user can view arbitrary file contents with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.5 Patch 6, 5.6 Patch 3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10020

Title: Cisco IronPort Encryption Appliance Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IronPort Encryption Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco IronPort device and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Cisco has assigned bug ID 72410 to this vulnerability.

Craig Lambert of Dell SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco IronPort device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.5.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=25045

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco IronPort) FreeBSD Telnet Encryption Feature Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): (C-Series and X-Series) prior to 7.6.0; (M-Series) prior to 7.8.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD Telnet. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco IronPort is affected.
If the telnetd(8) is enabled, a remote user can supply a specially crafted encryption key to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the telnet daemon (typically root privileges).
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco is has issued a fix for Cisco IronPort/Cisco Email Security Appliance (7.1.5-101, 7.3.1-101, 7.5.1-102, 7.6.1-022, 7.7.0-757, 8.0.6-073l 8.1.0-235).

Cisco has assigned IronPort bug 83262  Cisco bug ID CSCzv32432 (for Cisco ESA) and CSCuo90523 (for Cisco WSA).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120126-ironport

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for Enterprise Manager) Kerberos GSS-API Library Null Pointer Dereference Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Kerberos. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 Enterprise Manager is affected.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted GSS-API token with a missing checksum field to trigger a null pointer dereference in krb5_gss_accept_sec_context() and cause the target GSS-API service to crash.  The kadmind server is affected.

Shawn Emery (Oracle) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target GSS-API service to crash.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for Enterprise Manager (2.3.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/products/em/releasenotes/product/relnote-em-2-3-0.html

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun SPARC) NTP Mode 7 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ntp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Sun SPARC server is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted NTP packet to create a packet reply loop between two target ntpd servers.  This may consume excessive CPU and disk resources on the target system.

Robin Park and Dmitri Vinokurov reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive CPU and disk space consumption on the target servers.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for Sun SPARC Server.

The Oracle advisory is available at:

http://blogs.oracle.com/sunsecurity/entry/multiple_vulnerabilities_in_network_time

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun SPARC) ntp Buffer Overflow in ntpq cookedprint() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ntpq. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Sun SPARC server is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Apple reported this vulnerability.

On June 25, 2009, Sun reported that Solaris is not affected by this vulnerability [http://blogs.sun.com/security/entry/solaris_not_impacted_by_cve].
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for Sun SPARC Server.

The Oracle advisory is available at:

http://blogs.oracle.com/sunsecurity/entry/multiple_vulnerabilities_in_network_time

Title: (Oracle Issues Fix for Sun Netra) NTP Signature Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Validation Checks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NTP. A remote user can bypass digital signature validation. Sun Netra SPARC server is affected.
The software does not properly check the results of the OpenSSL EVP_VerifyFinal() function.  As a result, a remote server can supply a specially crafted invalid signature on a certificate that will be detected as a valid certificate.  Signature checks on DSA and ECDSA keys used with SSL/TLS are affected.

Clients that connect to servers using RSA keys are not affected.

Client certificate validation is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix for Sun Netra.

The Oracle advisory is available at:

http://blogs.oracle.com/sunsecurity/entry/multiple_vulnerabilities_in_network_time

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for ProxyAV) Mozilla Firefox Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. Blue Coat ProxyAV is affected by one vulnerability.
A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

SeaMonkey versions prior to 2.0.6 are affected by some of these vulnerabilities.

Thunderbird versions prior to 3.0.6 and 3.1.1 are affected by some of these vulnerabilities.

Jesse Ruderman, Ehsan Akhgari, Mats Palmgren, Igor Bukanov, Gary Kwong, Tobias Markus, Daniel Holbert, David Anderson, Johnny Stenback, regenrecht via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative, J23 via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative, moz_bug_r_a4, and OUSPG researcher Aki Helin reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix (3.4.1.1) for CVE-2010-1205 (libpng) for ProxyAV.

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA65

Title: Barracuda Link Balancer Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Barracuda Link Balancer.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The 'Authoritative DNS - DNS Zones' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'zoneid' and 'scope' parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Barracuda Link Balancer software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on April 18, 2011.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=33

Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Rem0ve) from Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Barracuda Link Balancer software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: (Check Point Issues Fix for Connectra) Apache httpd Byterange Filter Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apache. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Check Point Connectra is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted requests to cause the HTTP byterange filter code to consume excessive memory on the target system. This may cause the target system to become unstable.

The 'Range' and 'Range-Request' headers are affected.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/17696/

Kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to become unstable.
Solution:
Check Point has issued a fix for Connectra.

The Check Point advisory is available at:

https://supportcenter.checkpoint.com/supportcenter/portal?eventSubmit_doGoviewsolutiondetails=&solutionid=sk65222

Title: Cisco Show and Share Lets Remote Users Access Some Administrative Pages and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Show and Share. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can access some administrative pages.
A remote authenticated user with privileges to upload videos can upload a specially crafted file and then cause the web server to execute arbitrary code in the file [CVE-2011-2585]. The code will run with the privileges of the target web server. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto69857 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can access several administrative pages, including pages for accessing Encoders and Pull Configurations, Push Configurations, Video Encoding Formats, and Transcoding [CVE-2011-2584]. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto73758 to this vulnerability.

Andy Yang and Mehdi Kiani of stratsec reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can access some administrative pages.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2(2.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20111019-sns

Title: Check Point Safe@Office Input Validation Flaws Permits Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Check Point Safe@Office. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting and cross-site request forgery attacks.
The web user interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Check Point Safe@Office web user interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Check Point UTM Edge is also affected.

Richard Brain of ProCheckUp Ltd. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Check Point Safe@Office user interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2.44).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://supportcenter.checkpoint.com/supportcenter/portal?eventSubmit_doGoviewsolutiondetails=&solutionid=sk65460

Title: Symantec Brightmail KeyView Filter Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Brightmail. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target filter, will cause a child process to crash.

The vulnerabilities reside in the third party Autonomy Verity Keyview Filter component.

A specially crafted Ichitaro Speed Reader document can trigger this flaw [CVE-2011-0337, CVE-2011-0338, CVE-2011-0339].

A specially crafted Excel file can trigger this flaw [CVE-2011-1213, CVE-2011-1512].

A specially crafted LZH archive can trigger this flaw [CVE-2011-1214].

A specially crafted RTF attachment can trigger this flaw [CVE-2011-1215].

A specially crafted Applix spreadsheet can trigger this flaw [CVE-2011-1216].

A specially crafted Zip File Viewer document can trigger this flaw [CVE-2011-1218].

Binaryhouse.net (via iDefense Labs), CoreLabs Research, Secunia Research, and CERT.org reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target filter, will cause partial denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Symantec Messaging Gateway 9.5.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/business/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2011&suid=20111006_00

Title: Cisco Network Admission Control Manager Directory Traversal Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Network Admission Control Manager. A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system, including password files and system logs.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq10755 to this vulnerability.

Manager versions 4.7.X and prior versions are not affected.

The appliance itself is not affected.

Nenad Stojanovski reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system, including password files and system logs.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.9), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/cisco/pub/software/portal/select.html?&i=!m&mdfid=279515766

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20111005-nac.shtml

Title: Sunway ForceControl Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users View Files, Deny Service, and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Sunway ForceControl. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can view files on the target system.
The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system. A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/.../.../.../boot.ini

A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 8800 to trigger a stack overflow in AngelServer.

A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the 'YRWXls.ocx' ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: BD9E5104-2F20-4A9F-AB14-82D558FF374E

A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 8800 to cause the target AngelServer service to crash.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 2001 to trigger a stack overflow or integer overflow in SNMP NetDBServer and execute arbitrary code.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 2001 to cause the SNMP NetDBServer to crash.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to NetServer via TCP port 2006 to view arbitrary files on the target system.

Some demonstration exploit code is available at:

http://aluigi.org/testz/udpsz.zip

Luigi Auriemma reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Default Credentials Let Remote Users Gain Administrative Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can gain administrative control.
The device uses default credentials for the database. A remote attacker can use the credentials to gain administrative control of the device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCts59135 to this vulnerability.

Andrey Ovrashko and Sergey Bondarenko of BMS Consulting, Ukraine, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative control of the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.0.4.MR2; to be available on September 30, 2011).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110920-ise.shtml

Title: Blue Coat Director HTTP Trace Processing Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat Director. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the HTTP TRACE method before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Blue Coat Director interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code may be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Impact': A remote user may be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Blue Coat Director software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued an interim fix (5.5.2.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA62

Title: FortiAnalyzer Unspecified Input Validation Flaw in Log Access Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FortiAnalyzer. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the FortiAnalyzer device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The Log & Archive, Log Access, IPS (Attack) function is affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vulnerability-lab.com/get_content.php?id=145

Benjamin Kunz Mejri (Rem0ve) from Vulnerability Research Laboratory reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the FortiAnalyzer device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Citrix Access Gateway Enterprise Edition Input Validation Flaw in Logon Portal Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Citrix Access Gateway Enterprise Edition. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The logon portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Citrix Access Gateway software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Citrix Access Gateway software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.2-50.4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.citrix.com/article/CTX129971

Title: TippingPoint SMS Server Bug in JBoss Component Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in TippingPoint SMS Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can exploit an unspecified flaw in JBoss to install and then execute arbitrary packages on the target device.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: TippingPoint has issued a fix (3.2.0.8312 Patch 5).

Title: Siemens SIMATIC S7-300 PLCs Undocumented Diagnostic Account Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Siemens SIMATIC S7-300 PLCs. A remote user can access the target system.
Certain models of the S7-300 series include an undocumented user account with a hardcoded username and password (both 'Basisk'), intended for diagnostic purposes. A remote user can connect to the integrated PLC network interface and login to the system using the account. This can be exploited to dump memory, delete files, and execute commands.

The S7-400 PLCs are not affected.

Dillon Beresford of NSS Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for some models (as of the following dates):

    CPU314C-2PN/DP since V3.3 01/2010 (first release)
    CPU315(incl. F)-2PN/DP since V3.1 10/2009
    CPU317(incl. F)-2PN/DP since V3.1 10/2009
    CPU319(incl. F)-3PN/DP since V2.8 06/2009
    IM151-8(incl. F)-PN/DP since V3.2 08/2010
    IM154-8 PN/DP since V3.2 08/2010

S7-300 Profinet PLCs shipped before October 2009 and IM15x Profinet PLCs shipped before September 2010 are still vulnerable.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.automation.siemens.com/WW/llisapi.dll?func=cslib.csinfo&lang=en&objid=51810333&caller=view

Title: Cisco SA500 Series Security Appliance Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco SA500 Series Security Appliance. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The login form of the web management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2011-2546]. This can be exploited to obtain usernames and passwords for accounts on the device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq65669 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user on the web management interface can send specially crafted parameters via several web forms to execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2011-2547].  The commands will run with root privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq65681 to this vulnerability.

The following models are affected by these vulnerabilities:

Cisco SA520
Cisco SA520W
Cisco SA540

Michal Sajdak of Securitum, Poland, reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target system.

A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.1.19).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110720-sa500.shtml

Title: HP ArcSight Connectors Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ArcSight Connectors. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Windows Event Log SmartConnector does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in imported files before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted report file that, when imported for editing by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the HP ArcSight Connectors appliance and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Michael Rutkowski of Duer Advanced Technology and Aerospace, Inc (DATA) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the HP ArcSight Connectors device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (6.1).

Title: Citrix Access Gateway Plug-in for Windows Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Citrix Access Gateway Plug-in for Windows. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the Plug-in for Windows ActiveX control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

Joshua J. Drake and Michal Trojnara of iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.1-67.7, 9.0-70.5, 9.1-96.4).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.citrix.com/article/CTX129902

Title: (Infoblox Issues Fix for Infoblox NIOS) ISC BIND Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Infoblox NIOS is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target 'named' service to exit. Recursive and authoritative servers are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target DNS service to exit.
Solution:
Infoblox has issued a fix for Infoblox NIOS (5.1r3-10, 5.1r4-4, 6.0.7, 6.1.3), which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Infoblox advisory is available at:

http://www.infoblox.com/en/support/support-center-login.html

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Input Validation Flaw in 'forget.php' Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Web Gateway. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The management GUI does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The 'username' parameter of 'forget.php' is affected (via POST request).

The vendor was notified on April 1, 2011.

An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.0.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/business/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2011&suid=20110707_00

Title: Cisco Content Services Gateway ICMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Services Gateway.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted ICMP packets to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl79577 to this vulnerability.

Only the second generation of Cisco Content Services Gateway is affected. The first generation is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.4(24)MDA5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110706-csg.shtml

Title: Sunway pNetPower AngelServer Heap Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sunway pNetPower. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to the target 'AngelServer.exe' process to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Dillon Beresford of NSS Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.sunwayland.com.cn/news_info_.asp?Nid=3593

Title: Sunway ForceControl Heap Overflow in WebServer Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sunway ForceControl. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to trigger a heap overflow in 'httpsvr.exe' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Dillon Beresford of NSS Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.sunwayland.com.cn/news_info_.asp?Nid=3593

Title: Siemens SIMATIC S7-1200 Controller Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Replay and Denial of Service Attacks
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Siemens SIMATIC S7-1200 Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks to replay commands.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target web service to overload the communications interface and cause the control process to stop. Firmware version 02.00.02 is affected.

A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between the controller and the controlling computer can capture packets and replay commands.

Dillon Beresford of NSS Labs reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: ICS-CERT reports that there are additional vulnerabilities not described above that remain unpatched.]
Impact':
A remote user can cause the control process to stop.

A remote user can conduct replay attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a firmware fix.

[Editor's note: The vendor's advisory at the time of this entry did not include version number or availability information for the firmware fix. Also, ICS-CERT reports that there are additional vulnerabilities not described above that remain unpatched.]

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.automation.siemens.com/WW/llisapi.dll/csfetch/50428932/Siemens_Security_Advisory_SSA-625789.pdf

Title: Symantec Brightmail Buffer Overflow in KeyView Filter Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Brightmail/Symantec Messaging Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Lotus Freelance Graphics PRZ file to cause partial denial of service conditions.

The vulnerability resides in the Autonomy Verity KeyView Filter component.

alino from binaryhouse.net reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Symantec Messaging Gateway 9.5.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/business/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2011&suid=20110531_00

Title: Cisco Network Registrar Default Credentials Grant Administrative Access to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Network Registrar. A remote user can gain administrative access.
A remote user can use the common default password to gain administrative access and modify the configuration. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsm50627 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.2).

The vendor has also described a workaround for prior versions in their advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110601-cnr.shtml

Title: Intel 10 Gigabit Ethernet Controllers Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Intel 10 Gigabit Ethernet Controllers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause unspecified denial of service conditions on the target device.

The Intel 10 Gigabit Ethernet 82598 and 82599 Controllers are affected.

A business partner reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://security-center.intel.com/advisory.aspx?intelid=INTEL-SA-00028&languageid=en-fr

Title: Samsung Data Management Server Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Samsung Data Management Server (DMS). A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The DMS web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.securitybydefault.com/2011/05/una-inyeccion-sql-que-te-dejara-helado.html

Additional information is available at:

http://www.us-cert.gov/control_systems/pdf/ICSA-11-069-01.pdf

Jose A. Guasch from SecurityByDefault.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (1.4.3).

Title: Cisco Content Services Gateway Bugs Let Users Bypass Billing Policies and Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Content Services Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass access controls and billing policies.
A remote user can access sites via HTTP without the billing policy being enforced [CVE-2011-0348]. A remote user can also access URLs that are explicitly denied. The Cisco Content Services Gateway - Second Generation (CSG2), which runs on the Cisco Service and Application Module for IP (SAMI), is affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtk35917 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target device to hang and stop passing traffic [CVE-2011-0349, CVE-2011-0350]. A manual reload of the SAMI card may be required to return to normal operations. Only Cisco IOS Software Release 12.4(24)MD1 on the Cisco CSG2 is affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCth17178 and CSCth41891 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Content Services Gateway - 1st Generation (CSG) is not affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can access sites without the billing policy being enforced.

A remote user can access URLs that are explicitly denied.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.4(24)MD3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110126-csg2.shtml

Title: Symantec Web Gateway Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Web Gateway.  A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The management console GUI does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.5.0.376).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.symantec.com/business/security_response/securityupdates/detail.jsp?fid=security_advisory&pvid=security_advisory&year=2011&suid=20110112_00

Title: Citrix Access Gateway Flaw in Legacy NT Authentication Component Lets Remote Users Inject Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Standard and Advanced Editions prior to 5.0; Enterprise Edition up to version 9.2-49.8
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Citrix Access Gateway.  A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote user can subvert the authentication process and potentially execute commands on the target device with 'root' user privileges.

The NT4 authentication component of Access Gateway Enterprise and the NTLM authentication component of Access Gateway Standard Edition are affected.

George Gal of VSR (http://www.vsecurity.com/) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target device with root user privileges.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vulnerable functions have been deprecated.  Customers should migrate to another, non-vulnerable authentication method.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.citrix.com/article/CTX127613

Title: Cisco Unified Videoconferencing Lets Remote Users Access the System and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Videoconferencing.  A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A remote user can access the system using default credentials.
The Linux shell contains three hard-coded usernames and passwords that cannot be changed or deleted [CVE-2010-3038].  A remote user can access the accounts.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54008 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to to the web server interface to inject and execute arbitrary commands with root-level privilege on the target system [CVE-2010-3037].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54059 to this vulnerability.

The system stores administrator and operator account passwords for the web interface in unencrypted form.  A local user can obtain the passwords.  Only Linux-based Cisco UVC products are affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54010 to this vulnerability.

The FTP server is enabled by default.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti72032 to this vulnerability.

The shadow password file on Linux-based Cisco UVC products is world-readable.  Cisco as assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54043 to this vulnerability.

The SSH server permits X.11 forwarding and socks proxies by default.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54045 to this vulnerability.

The web interface on Linux-based Cisco UVC products runs with root privileges.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54047 to this vulnerability.

The web interface uses predictable session IDs.  A remote user may be able to hijack a user session.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54048 to this vulnerability.

The system stores user credentials in cookies on the target user's system.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti54052 to this vulnerability.

The following Cisco UVC Linux operating system products are affected by some of these vulnerabilities:

  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 5110 System
  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 5115 System

The following Cisco UVC VxWorks operating system products are affected by some of these vulnerabilities:

  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 5230 System
  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 3545 System
  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 3527 Primary Rate Interface (PRI) Gateway
  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 3522 Basic Rate Interfaces (BRI) Gateway
  * Cisco Unified Videoconferencing 3515 Multipoint Control Unit (MCU)

Florent Daigniere of Matta Consulting reported these vulnerabilities.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.trustmatta.com/advisories/MATTA-2010-001.txt
Impact':
A remote user can access the system.

A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root-level privileges.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has described some mitigation steps in their advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20101117-cuvc.shtml

Title: LANDesk Management Gateway Input Validation Error Lets Remote Authenticated Administrators Injection Operating System Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in LANDesk Management Gateway.  A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to inject operating system commands on the target system.  The commands will run with 'gsbadmin' user privileges.  This can be exploited to shutdown the firewall or load arbitrary kernel modules.

The vendor was notified on October 18, 2010.

Aureliano Calvo from Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrator can execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (LANDesk Management Gateway 4.0 GSBWEB v1.62, LANDesk Management Gateway 4.2 GSBWEB v1.62).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://community.landesk.com/support/docs/DOC-21767

Title: NitroView ESM Input Validation Flaw in 'ess.pm' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NitroView ESM.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
The 'ess.pm' script does not properly validate user-supplied data before making a system() call.  A remote user can send specially crafted data to the 'ess.pm' script to execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Systems with the 'ESSPMDebug=1' option in '/usr/local/ess/CPConsoleServer.cfg' are affected.

The vendor was notified on September 22, 2010.

s_n reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: Blue Coat ProxyAV Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxyAV.  A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target administrative user.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target administrative user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2.6.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA46

Title: IBM Proventia Network Mail Security System Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM Proventia Network Mail Security System.  A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The Web-based Local Management Interface does not properly validate user-supplied input.  A remote user cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will be able to take actions on the target device acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on November 9, 2009.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.ventuneac.net/security-advisories/MVSA-10-006

Dr. Marian Ventuneac reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target device acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix (2.5.0.2).

Title: IBM Proventia Network Mail Security System Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM Proventia Network Mail Security System.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Web-based Local Management Interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the Proventia device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The saved search filters are affected.

Various parameters of 'pvm_messagestore.php' are affected.

The 'userfilter' parameter of 'pvm_user_management.php' is affected.

The 'ping' parameter of 'sys_tools.php' is affected.

The 'action' parameter of 'pvm_cert_commaction.php' is affected.

The 'action' parameter of 'pvm_cert_serveraction.php' is affected.

The 'action' parameter of 'pvm_smtpstore.php' is affected.

The 'l' parameter  of '/sla/index.php' is affected.

The vendor was notified on November 8 2009.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.ventuneac.net/security-advisories/MVSA-10-007

Dr. Marian Ventuneac reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Proventia device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.5.0.2).

The fix was issued in March 2010.

Title: EMC Disk Library Communications Module Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in EMC Disk Library.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data via TCP to cause the target communications module to crash.  A system reboot is required to return the target device to return to normal operations.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target communications module to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

* EMC Disk Library (EDL) 3.2.7 and later Service Packs
* EMC Disk Library (EDL) 3.3.2 and epatch 8, and later Service Packs
* EMC Disk Library (EDL) 4.0.1 and epatch 4, and later Service Packs

Title: Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input when inserting a new user account before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.
